This is why she has found herself needing to ask for the first time for a loan of 1500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa, that will help her achieve her goal. Her greatest hope is to give her daughter a good education and a better quality of life. She is a strong mother, who has been able to keep going despite difficulties.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of summer clothing to expand the business.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
La señora Sofía es socia del Banco Comunal “Generación 2000” desde hace 14 años atrás, del distrito de Santa Rosa, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno, tiene 39 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 04 hijos. Ella estudió hasta cuarto de secundaria, tiene su tienda de abarrotes.

Sofía nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, lo que le sirvió para aumentar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar  arroz,  azúcar, fideos, panetón,  etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es abrir una bodega grande y así poder vivir feliz sin problemas con mi familia. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro que gana y las reuniones con las socias
texts.en:
Sofía, 39, has been a member of the “Generación 2000” communal bank, which is in Santa Rosa district, El Collao province, Puno department, for the last 14 years. She lives with her life partner and has 4 children. She finished 10th grade and has a grocery store. Sofía tells us that she used her first, 300 new sol, loan from the Manuela Ramos Movement to increase her capital. She is now requesting 3000 new soles with which to buy rice, sugar, pasta, panettones (a Christmas dinner staple), etc. Her dream for the future is to open a large store so that she can live with her family happy and problem-free. What she likes best about her communal bank is the savings she earns and the get-togethers with her fellow members.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, pasta, sugar, panettones (a Christmas dinner staple)

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “La Juleñita” desde hace 4 años atrás, del distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 34 años de edad, es casada y tiene 03 hijos. Ella estudió secundaria completa, se dedica a la compra y venta de repuestos de carro.

Rosa nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, lo que le sirvió para aumentar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar  liquido, grasa, frenos, pernos, crucetas.

Su sueño para el futuro es formar una microempresa automotriz y que sus hijos sean profesionales. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro que gana y la puntualidad que existe en el grupo
texts.en:
For the past 4 years, Mrs. Rosa has been a member of the “La Juleñita” communal bank is the Juli district of the Chucuito province in the department of Puno. She is 34 years old, married with 3 children. She finished secondary school and now buys and sells spare automobile parts. Rosa tells us that with her first loan from the “Movimiento Manuela Ramos”, a loan of 300 Nuevos soles, she was able to increase her capital. She is soliciting a loan of 2000 Nuevos soles which she will use to buy brake fluid, oil, brakes, and bolts. Her dreams for the future is to start a small automotive business and that her children become professionals. The things she most likes about her communal banks is the savings she earns and the punctuality that exists in the group.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy brake fluid, oil, brakes, and bolts

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
La señora Rufina es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Bárbara 2” desde hace 4 años atrás, del distrito de Chucuito, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 52 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 01 hijo. Ella estudió primaria completa, se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa.

Rufina nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, lo que le sirvió para aumentar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 1,800.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar  ropa y así aumentar su mercadería.

Su sueño para el futuro es mejorar su negocio y vivir tranquila sin preocupaciones. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro que gana y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Rufina, 52, has been a member of the “Santa Bárbara 2” communal bank, which is in Chucuito district, Puno province and department, for the last 4 years. She is a single mother of one son. She finished elementary school and she is a clothing merchant. Rufina tells us that she used her first, 300 new sol, loan from the Manuela Ramos Movement to increase her capital. She now needs 1800 new soles to buy clothing to increase her stock. Her dream for the future is to improve her business and to live in peace and worry-free. What she likes best about her communal bank is the savings and the meetings with her fellow members.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es:
La señorita Aydee es socia del Banco Comunal “La Juleñita” desde hace 6 años atrás, del distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 30 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Ella estudió superior completa, se dedica a la compra y venta de abarrotes y coca.

Aydee nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, lo que le sirvió para aumentar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 700.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar  arroz, azúcar, fideos, etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener una bodega grande y ejercer su profesión. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro que gana.
texts.en:
Srta. Aydee has been a member of the Communal Bank “La Juleñita” for six years. She lives in the District of Juli, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. Aydee is 30 years old, single, and does not have children. She completed college and currently sells groceries and coca leaves.

Aydee tells us that the first loan she requested from Manuela Ramos was in the amount of 300 soles and used to increase her capital. She is requesting a new loan of 700 soles to buy rice, sugar, noodles, and other products. Her dream is to open a large grocery store and continue working. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank is the savings account in which she earns interest.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, noodles, and other products

loans.name: Ana Santusa

texts.es:
La señora Ana es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Bárbara 2” desde hace 1 año atrás, del distrito de Chucuito, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 45 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 06 hijos, de ellos 3 están a su lado. Ella estudió secundaria incompleta, se dedica a la venta de artesanía.

Ana nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, lo que le sirvió para aumentar su capital y comprar más lana e hilos.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar bayeta y lana.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa propia y su tienda de artesanías. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad de las socias y las promotoras, para cada reunión.
texts.en:
Ana has been a member of the Santa Barbara 2 communal bank for 1 year, which is located in the district of Chucuito, province and state of Puno. She is 45 years old, lives with her partner, and has 6 children, 3 of whom live with her. She did not complete secondary school. She sells handicrafts for a living. Ana tells us that with her first loan from the Manuela Ramos Movement, for 500 soles, she increased her capital and purchased more wool and string. She is requesting a loan for 500 soles which she will use to buy baize and wool. Her dream for the future is to have her own home and handicrafts shop. What she likes best about the communal bank is the punctuality of the members and facilitators for each meeting.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool, baize, and string

loans.name: Ernestina Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Ernestina Del Socorro tiene 49 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo, que es mayor de edad. La señora se dedica a una pulpería, pues ha puesto todo su empeño en mejorar cada día. La ubicación de su negocio es en su humilde vivienda. Ella dio inicio a este negocio hace 10 años, en la búsqueda de fuentes alternativas de ingresos para la manutención de su familia. Ella empezó vendiendo muy poco, ahora posee una clientela bien establecida, además que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y ganarse la vida de una manera muy humilde. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de materias primas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar aceite, carnes y gaseosas. Su sueño es llegar a tener un restaurante, que brinden mayores ingresos a su familia en general.
texts.en:
Ernestina Del Socorro is 49 years old. She is a single mother and has one son, who is an adult. Ernestina runs a small grocery store, and has worked hard to make it better every day. The store is located in her humble home. She began this business 10 years ago, looking for alternative sources of income in order to care for her family. She started out selling very little, but now she has an established customer base. She also has always liked working and making a living in this humble way. The loan will be invested in the purchase of basic materials such as rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, meat and soft drinks. Her dream is to have a restaurant, that will provide a better income for all her family.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Funds for business

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Teresa es socia del Banco Comunal “Generación 2000” desde hace 9 años atrás, del distrito de Santa Rosa, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno, tiene 29 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 02 hijos. Ella estudió superior completa, tiene su tienda de ropa y un restaurante.

Teresa nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, lo que le sirvió para aumentar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar ropa, casacas, pantalones al por mayor.

Su sueño para el futuro es ser empresaria y tener su casa en Puno. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad de las socias para las reuniones.
texts.en:
Teresa has been a member of the Generación 2000 communal bank for nine years, which is located in the district of Santa Rosa, El Collao province, Puno state. She is 29 years old, lives with her partner, and has 2 children. She completed secondary school and has a clothing shop and a restaurant. Teresa tells us that with the first loan she requested from the Manuela Ramos Movement, for 300 soles, she increased her capital. She is requesting a loan for 3,000 soles which she will use to purchase clothes, jackets, and pants wholesale. Her dream for the future is to be a businesswoman and have a house in Puno. What she likes best about her communal bank is the punctuality of the members at meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of jackets, pants

loans.name: Mercedes Antonieta

texts.en:
Mercedes is a client of Asociación Arariwa. She is member of a communal bank consisting of 19 members in Cusco. The group is called Killa, which means “moon” in Quechua. Mercedes is married and lives in Cusco with her six-year-old son. Her husband works on cruise ships so he is away most of the year.

Mercedes runs a small fast food restaurant in Cusco that she opened a little over a year ago. She sells mainly chicken and sandwiches and keeps the restaurant open from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. Mercedes used her savings and some of her husband’s as well for the initial start-up capital, which was sufficient to fully equip the kitchen. Now she needs a loan to buy additional chairs and tables, as well as chicken and potatoes.

Mercedes appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: Tables, chairs, and food for restaurant

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es: Alejandrina tiene 32 años, vive con su pareja y su pequeño hijo, por el cual trabaja y se esfuerza a diario.Desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de ropa  en un local ubicado  en uno de los mercados mas concurridos de la  zona por donde vive; le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que puede lograr un ingreso extra al sueldo de su pareja y juntos  le pueden ofrecer  mayor bienestar a su pequeño hijo, usualmente trabaja todos los días de 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde , ofrece variedad de ropa que trae desde el centro de la ciudad para venderla a un poco mas de su precio, trata de que sea muy peculiar con  bonitos diseños y colores, factores que han determinado que su negocio  sea muy visitado sobretodo por jóvenes  que buscan adquirir estas prendas con el consejo de Alejandrina, que tiene un gran poder de convencimiento . En el futuro quiere aperturar un bazar para abarcar mayor  cantidad de clientela.Es su primer préstamo con MFP y según sus propias palabras su responsabilidad en su trabajo abogan por el pago puntual de  cada una de sus cuotas.Con el dinero del crédito quiere comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería para lograr vender mas sobretodo por la campaña navideña y el año nuevo, ya que las personas buscarán comprar ropa nueva, y sabe que será una buena oportunidad para obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is 32 years old and lives with her partner and their little son, for whom she works and makes an effort every day. For a year, she has been selling clothing at a stall in one of the busiest markets in the area where she lives. She likes her job very much because she can get an income in addition to her partner's salary, and together they can offer their son a better well-being. She usually works every day from 8 in the morning to 6 in the evening. She offers a variety of clothing that she brings from the center of town in order to sell at a bit of a profit. She tries to get unique clothing with pretty designs and color. For this reason her store is visited principally by young people who want to buy these clothes based on Alejandrina's suggestions, because she is very convincing. In the future she wants to open a store with various products in order to attract more customers. This is her first loan with MFP and as she says, her responsibility in her work shows that she will be on time with each of her repayments. With the money from the loan she wants to buy more merchandise in order to sell more. This is particularly because of the Christmas and New Years celebrations, because people are looking to buy new clothes and she knows it will be a good opportunity to get better returns.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise to improve her store.

loans.name: Bacilia

texts.es:
La señora Bacilia es socia del Banco Comunal “La Juleñita” desD. hace 2 años atrás, del distrito D. Juli, provincia D. Chucuito, departamento D. Puno, tiene 60 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 08 hijos. Ella no estudió, se dedica a la compra y venta D. combustible.

Bacilia nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, lo que le sirvió para aumentar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  D. S/. 400.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar kerosene al por mayor.

Su sueño para el futuro es vivir tranquila ya no tiene a nadie a quien mantener. 

Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal son los ahorros y la puntualidad D. las demás socias.
texts.en:
Bacilia has been a member of the La Juleñita communal bank for 2 years, located in the Juli district, Cucuito province, Puno state. She is 60 years old, married, and has 8 children. She did not attend school and makes a living buying and selling fuel. With her first loan that she took out with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 300 soles, she increased her capital. She is requesting a loan for 400 soles to purchase kerosene wholesale. Her dream is to live peacefully as she does not have anyone to support. What she likes best about her communal bank are the savings and the punctuality of the other members.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase kerosene

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
La señora Delia es socia del Banco Comunal “Generación 2000” desde hace 3 años atrás, del distrito de Santa Rosa, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno, tiene 48 años de edad, es casada y tiene 05 hijos. Ella estudió primaria completa, se dedica a la compra y venta de carne.  Paralelamente se dedica a la crianza de animales como cerdos.

Delia nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, lo que le sirvió para aumentar su capital y comprar más carne.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar carne de alpaca, cordero, chancho, etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener su empresa de carne. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
Sra. Delia became a member of the Generation 2000 Communal Bank three months ago. She lives in the District of Santa Rosa, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. Delia is 48 years old, married, and has five children. She has an elementary school education and makes a living buying and selling meat. At the same time, she raises animals such as pigs.

Delia tells us that that the first loan she requested from Manuela Ramos was for 500 soles and used to increase her capital so that she could buy more meat. She will request a new loan of 2000 soles so that she can buy alpaca, lamb, pork, and other types of meats. Her dream for the future is to open a butcher shop. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank is the savings account.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase alpaca, lamb, pork, and other types of meats

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
La señora Lorenza es socia del Banco Comunal “Generación 2000” desde hace 3 años atrás, del distrito de Santa Rosa, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno, tiene 56 años de edad, es casada y tiene 02 hijos. Ella no estudió, se dedica a la compra y venta de golosinas.

Lorenza nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, lo que le sirvió para aumentar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar           galletas, chocolates, panetones, yogures, etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es seguir trabajando para así progresar y capitalizarme. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro que gana
texts.en:
Sra. Lorenza became a member of the Generation 2000 Communal Bank three months ago. She lives in the District of Santa Rosa, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. Lorenza is 56 years old, married, and has two children. She did not attend school, but she makes a living buying and selling sweets.

Lorenza tells us that that the first loan she requested from Manuela Ramos was for 500 soles and was used to increase her capital. She will request a new loan of 2000 soles so that she can buy cookies, chocolates, panettone, yogurt, and other products. Her dream for the future is to continue working so that she can improve and build capital. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank is the savings account that earns interest.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cookies, chocolates, panettone, yogurt, etc.

loans.name: María Elvidia

texts.es: María Elvidia C. Vda. D. C. D. 59 años D. edad, resiD. en Santa Tecla, departamento D. La Libertad, vive junto a un hijo el cual es minusválido, es por esto que él depenD. D. su madre, así mismo vive junto a un nieto. Ella posee una venta D. ropa y zapatos en el mercado D. San Tecla, venta con la cual inició hace 12 años D. manera ambulante, y ahora gracias a su esfuerzo y trabajo posee un puesto en el mercado. María solicita un préstamo, ya que desea poder comprar nuevos estilos D. zapatos, así mismo diferentes tallas y colores D. ropa. Ella espera poder mejorar sus ventas sobre todo en este mes en las personas cuentan con la capacidad para comprar o se esfuerzan por comprarle ropa a sus hijos. Es por ello que María desea aprovechar la temporada e incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
María Elvidia C. Vda. D. C., who is 59 years old, lives in Santa Tecla in the department of La Libertad. She lives with one son who is handicapped, and who depends on his mother for this reason. A grandson also lives with her. She owns a clothing and shoe store in the market of Santa Tecla. She began selling 12 years ago as a wandering merchant and now thanks to her hard work she has a permanent stall in the market. María is asking for a loan because she would like to be able to buy new styles of shoes, and also different sizes and colors of clothing. She hopes to improve her sales particularly during this month, when people are able to buy or make an real effort to buy clothes for their children. This is why María wants to take advantage of the season and increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of different sizes of shoes and clothing

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
La señora  SUSANA A. R. tiene 45  años, vive en el distrito DeL PORVENIR, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal UNIDAS POR SIEMPRE II. La socia presenta estudios  hasta 6to de Primaria , es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella. La socia se dedica a la venta de carne, verduras, frutas, aceite, jabones, etc. que lleva a  la sierra a vender y con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles lo utilizo para la compra de arroz, azúcar, carne, pollos, verduras, menestras, aceite, papas, etc.
Con este crédito de 200.00 nuevos soles comprará arroz, azúcar, golosinas, frutas, verduras, etc para llevara a vender a la sierra. Ella sueña con tener su bodega bien implementada.
texts.en:
Sra. Susana A. R. is 45 years old and lives in the District of El Porvenir, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Unidas por Siempre II” (Always United II). Susana has a sixth grade education, is in a common law marriage, and has five children who are financially dependent on her. She sells meat, vegetables, fruit, oil, soap, and other products. With her first loan of 300 soles, she was able to buy rice, sugar, meat, chicken, vegetables, canned stew, oil, potatoes, etc.

With this loan of 200 soles, Susana will purchase rice, sugar, sweets, fruit, vegetables, and other products to sell in the mountains. Her dream is to open a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of food products to sell

loans.name: Teresa Lavis

texts.es:
La señora  TERESA LAVIS G. F. tiene 49 años, vive en el distrito De Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES AL ÉXITO II. La socia presenta estudios  hasta 4to de Secundaria, es  madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales 1 depende de ella económicamente. La socia se dedica ha atender la tienda que tiene en su casa.
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles lo utilizó para la compra de arroz, azúcar, carne, pollos, verduras, menestras, aceite, papas, etc. para surtir su tienda.
Con este crédito de 1,000.00 nuevos soles lo utilizará para la compra de pollo, carne, atún, arroz, papas, menestras, leche, jugos, gaseosa, cerveza, etc. Ella sueña con ampliar su negocio y generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Sra. Teresa Lavis G. F. is 49 years old and lives in the District of Trujillo, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres al Éxito II” (Women of Success II). Teresa completed her education through the fourth year of secondary school. She is a single mother of three children of whom one is still financially dependent on her. Teresa manages a store out of her home. With her first loan of 300 soles, she was able to buy rice, sugar, meat, chicken, vegetables, canned stew, potatoes, and other products to restock her store.

With this loan of 1000 soles, Teresa will buy chicken, meat, tuna, rice, potatoes, canned stew, milk, juices, sodas, beer, and other products. Her dream is to expand her business and generate better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of merchandise for her store

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Bárbara 2” desde hace 9 años atrás, del distrito de Chucuito, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y tiene 03 hijos. Ella estudió primaria incompleta.  Ella tiene un restaurante.

Juana nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, lo que le sirvió para aumentar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar arroz, papa, carne.

Su sueño para el futuro es trabajar y mejorar cada día... así progresar. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad de las socias y las promotoras para cada reunión.
texts.en:
Juana has been a member of the community bank "Santa Bárbara 2" for 9 years in the district of Chucuito, from the province and region of Puno. She is 45 years old, married, and three children. She has an incomplete primary school education. She runs a restaurant. Juana's first loan request to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos was for S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, which she used to increase her business capital. She requests a loan of S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles, with which she will be able to buy rice, potatoes, and meat. Her dream for the future is to work and improve each day ... and through these means, progress. What she likes most about her community bank is the punctuality of the members and the promoters for each meeting.

Translated from Spanish by Colleen Godfrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, potatoes, and meat

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a client of Asociación Arariwa. She is member of a communal bank consisting of nineteen members in Cusco. The group is called Killa (“moon” in Quechua). Rosa lives with her partner and daughter in Cusco. Her partner works as a tour guide in and around Cusco and he sometimes helps Rosa with her business when he has time. Rosa’s daughter is studying medicine.

Rosa is about to launch a new restaurant in Cusco. She previously ran a snack stand catering mostly to university students, but was motivated by her desire to own and run her own restaurant. The area around the restaurant, on the Plaza Tupac Amaru, has several office buildings, a large police station and municipal buildings, so Rosa expects to have many potential customers.

Rosa used her savings to fully equip the restaurant and now needs a loan to buy food and to pay the four employees she will hire.  Rosa plans to launch her restaurant before the New Year. After receiving the loan proceeds, all that will be left will be for her to decide on a name.

Rosa appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly repayments on time.

loans.use: To use as start-up money to run new restaurant

loans.name: Cruz Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Cruz Del Socorro  tiene 54 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos y el hijo menor esta a su cargo. Ella tiene la actividad económica de venta de productos lácteos ubicada en su casa de habitación. Ella dio inicio a este negocio hace 21 años, ella empezó vendiendo leña y frijoles a sus vecinos. Sin embargo con el tiempo logro establecer su actividad. Ya que ella ha mejorado poco a poco su actividad. Su crédito será invertido en la compra de mayor cantidad de materia prima como queso, cuajada, mantequilla y crema. Por lo que es una mujer muy trabajadora y que es famosa por la venta de sus productos. Ella sueña con mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Cruz Del Socorro, 54, is married and has 4 children, the youngest of whom is still dependent on her. She sells dairy products from her home. She began her business 21 years ago selling beans and firewood to her neighbors. In time, she became established as she gradually improved her activity . She will use the funds to buy raw materials like: cheese, curd, butter and cream. She is a hard-working woman who is famous for the sale of her products. She dreams with making some home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials like cheese, curd, butter and cream.

loans.name: Cándida Del Transito

texts.es: Cándida del Transito S. D. L. D. 42 años D. edad, residen en el departamento D. San Salvador, vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos menores D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Ella posee una venta D. ropa para niños y adultos D. ambos sexos, este negocio lo tiene desD. hace 12 años, tiempo el cual Cándida ha trabajado arduamente para poder mejorar  la economía  familiar y poder brindarle una ayuda a su esposo. Cándida solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda invertir en su negocio, comprando mayor cantidad D. ropa, estilos y colores, D. manera que tenga más prendas que ofrecer a sus clientes. Con esto Cándida espera aumentar el número D. clientes que posee, ya que para ella es D. mucha importancia poder contribuir a su hogar y poder ver a sus hijos gozando D. todo lo necesario para vivir.
texts.en:
Cándida del Transito S. D. L., 42, lives in San Salvador department with her husband and three minor children, who are students. She sells children and adult, male and female, clothes. She has had this business for 12 years. Cándida works hard to improve family finances and to help her husband support the family. She is asking for financing to invest in her business buying a larger amount of clothing of various colors and styles so that she will have more stock available for sale. Cándida hopes that this will lead to an increase in the number of her customers because it is very important to her to be able to contribute to her home and to see her children enjoying all that is needed to live.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria de 46 años vive en su casa propia al lado de su hija Amy de 7 años, juntas buscan salir adelante a base de esfuerzo.Se dedica a la venta de cerveza y gaseosas en su casa, esta actividad  le resulta muy rentable ya que por la zona donde vive  la venta es muy buena, además se ha hecho fieles  clientes los que  prefieren comprarle a ella por ser una persona carismática y trabajadora . A Gloria le resulta muy cómodo este  tipo de trabajo  ya que puede realizarlo mientras atiende su  hogar, aunque también es un poco cansado ya  que sola  debe manipular las cajas que pesan mucho, lo positivo es que no  se deja abatir y siempre  trata de sacar lo productivo de todo lo que le sucede; en el  futuro quiere seguir trabajando para poner una tienda de abarrotes para obtener mayores  ingresos para el bienestar de su hija.Aunque es su primer préstamo con  MFP  promete ser puntual y responsable en cada uno de los pagos.Con el dinero del crédito quiere comprar más cajas de cervezas, ya que por fiestas de fin de año sabe que logrará muy buenas ventas.
texts.en:
Gloria, 46, lives in her own home with her 7-year-old daughter, Amy. Together, they seek to get ahead in life. She sells soft-drinks and beer from her house. This is a profitable business because in the area where she lives, sales are good. Besides, she has cultivated faithful, regular customers that prefer to buy from her because she is a charismatic and hard-working person. Gloria finds this work to be very comfortable because she can do it while still seeing to her domestic responsibilities although it is a bit tiring because she has to move the heavy cases alone. On the positive side, she doesn't flag and always tries to see the positive side of things that happen to her. In the future, she would like to continue to work in order to open a grocery store that will produce higher profits for the benefit of her daughter. Although this is her first loan with MFP, she pledges to be punctual with each of her payments. The funds will be used to buy cases of beer because she knows that the end-of-year festivities will produce very good sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cases of beer.

loans.name: Delia Maria

texts.es: La Señora Delia Maria tiene la edad de 48 años. Tiene 3 hijos que trabajan de manera independiente. Su actividad económica es la venta leña, frijoles cocidos cuajadas. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Por lo que tenía que buscar una fuente para sobrevivir, y debido a los pocos conocimientos de estudio que recibió, no pudo obtener un mejor trabajo. Delia es una mujer muy humilde, por lo que la ubicación de su negocio está situado en su vivienda pues con la ayuda de su esposo ha salido adelante, todas las compras de sus productos las realiza ene le mercado. El destino del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima. Su deseo es brindarle estabilidad económica a su familia.
texts.en:
Delia Maria, 48, has three independently employed children. She sells firewood, cooked beans and curds. She has been in this line of work for 5 years. Because of the poor schooling she got, her employment options were very limited. So, she had to come up with a way to earn income in order to survive. Delia is a very humble woman; her business is located in her home. With her husband's help, they get by. She buys all her supplies in the market. The funding will be used to buy raw materials. Her desire is to provide economic stability to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a client of Asociación Arariwa. She is member of a communal bank consisting of nineteen members in Cusco. The group is called Killa (“moon” in Quechua). Elizabeth lives with her partner, a metalworker, in Cusco. Elizabeth is 21 years old and is studying hotel administration in an institute in Cusco.

Elizabeth started a small business one-and-a-half years ago to be able to pay her tuition costs. She stands in a busy street corner in Cusco with cell phones and people passing by pay to use her phones to make calls. Elizabeth started with two cell phones and recently added two more. She plans to continue running this business until she graduates next year. Afterwards, she hopes to get a job in the tourism industry and sell her business to one of her younger sisters or cousins.

Elizabeth appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly repayments on time.

loans.use: To pay for her phones and for her studies

loans.name: Juan Santos

texts.es:
Juan tiene 29 años de edad, es casado y tiene 2 hijos, vive junto a su madre en el caserío La Pava, distrito de Mochumí, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos desde hace algunos meses. La idea de este negocio nació de la necesidad de contar con un ingreso más estable ya que antes se dedicaba al transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi y los ingresos económicos que percibía no le bastaban para sustentar a su familia.

Juan engorda los pollos para luego distribuirlos en las principales tiendas de la ciudad de Mochumí, su negocio cuenta con buena acogida por lo que Juan está pensando en ampliarlo,  pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción. Por este motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de más pollos para crianza y venta.

Su más grande anhelo es tener su casa propia y ofrecerle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida, Juan gusta mucho de su actividad y le dedica la mayor parte del tiempo posible.
texts.en:
Juan, 29, is married and has two children. He lives with his mother in the La Pava settlement, Mochumí department, which is an hour away from the city of Chiclayo. He has raised chickens for the last few months. This idea for a business grew from his need to have a more stable income; he used to transport cargo and passengers in a mototaxi but the earnings he received weren't sufficient to support his family. Juan fattens up chickens and then sells them to Mochumí's main stores. He is well received so he is planning on expanding. However, he lacks sufficient funds to do so. This is the reason he has called upon Edpyme Alternativa for the first time to request a 1500 new sol loan which will be used to buy more chickens to raise and sell. His greatest dream is to have his own house and to offer his children a better quality of life. Juan enjoys his work very much and dedicates the most time possible to it.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: La señora Maria De Los Ángeles se dedica a ofrecer los servicios de taller de costura. Ella tiene 1 hijo mayor que trabaja de manera independiente, sus esfuerzos de mejorar sus ingresos son su prioridad  por lo que fue su motivación con este negocio. Ella inicio este negocio hace mas de 41años y con mucho sacrificio tenía que encontrar la forma de establecer su propio negocio. El crédito será invertido en la compra de materia como hilos, telas, agujas, tijeras entre otros productos. Ella posee el sueño de mejorar las condiciones del negocio, para mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y de su hijo.
texts.en:
Maria De Los Ángeles is a seamstress. She has an adult son who works independently. Her motivation to set up this business was her desire to increase her income. She started over 41 years ago and, through much sacrifice, was able to establish her own business. The funds will be used to buy raw materials and supplies like: thread, fabric, needles, scissors, etc. Her dream is to improve her business's conditions in order to improve her own life as well as her son's.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy thread, fabric, needles, scissors.

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 45 años vive con su pareja y su hijo Jesús de 10 años, en su casa que es propia.Desde hace 1 año se dedica  a la venta de “ceviche ” (platillo tradicional peruano hecho a base  de pescado con limón), y  tiene gran demanda por la zona donde vive , porque es muy exquisito ya que los secretos de su preparación los aprendió de  su madre cuando era muy pequeña, desde entonces , como dice María nadie le gana en la  preparación, le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que es un don que posee y además puede generar buenos  ingresos económicos, todo para  beneficio de su pequeño hijo , por el cual trabaja y es el  motivo  de su esfuerzo diario , es por esta razón que  espera que estudie una profesión . En el  futuro tiene  pensado aperturar un negocio mas estable,  como un restaurante o  pollería (lugar donde se vende pollo a la brasa) para así formalizarse y lograr mejores ingresos, ya que sabe que tiene que mejorar, esas son sus expectativas para este nuevo año y espera concretarlas.Es su primer préstamo con  MFP y promete ser puntual en cada uno de sus  pagos ya que quiere seguir trabajando con esta entidad  para progresar aún más en la vida.Con el dinero del crédito quiere comprar más cantidad de ingredientes para aumentar sus ventas en el verano, y empezar a proyectarse para el futuro.
texts.en:
María, 45, lives in her own house with her life partner and her 10-year-old son, Jesús. For the last year she has sold "ceviche" (a typical Peruvian dish made primarily of fish and lemon juice). It is in high demand in the area where she lives because it is delicious and her secret way of preparing it, which she learned from her mother when she was a little girl, insures that nobody's is better than hers. She enjoys her work very much since this is gift she has and she can earn good income with it; all to benefit her young son, for whom she toils daily, in hopes that he will study a professional career. In the future, she hopes to open a more stable business, like a restaurant or a "pollería" (place where grilled chicken is sold) so that she can be formalized and earn better income. She knows she needs to improve and these are her expectation for the new year; she hopes to reach her goals. This is her first loan with MFP and she pledges to be punctual with each of her payments because she wants to continue to work with the institution in order to progress even more in life. She will use the funds to buy greater amounts of raw materials to increase her sales in the Summer and to start to project herself into the future.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her meals preparation.

loans.name: Yesenia Lucia

texts.es: Yesenia Lucia es madre luchadora tiene 2 hijos y están estudiando. La señora tiene como actividad una pulpería, que está ubicada en su vivienda. Por lo que es aquí donde comenzó a vender poco a poco para aumentar su inventario. Ella tiene 4 años con este negocio, por lo que siempre ha luchado para salir adelante con sus hijos a pesar de los difíciles problemas que han enfrentado pues a sus hijos le ofrecerle todo lo necesario. Ella está muy feliz con el trabajo que realiza pues sin él no tendría lo necesario para  comer todos los días.  El mayor  sueño es ampliar su negocio para que sea parte de la competencia.
texts.en:
Yesenia Lucia is a fighting mother of two children who are studying. Her activity is a general store located in her home. This is where she began her sales, little by little increasing her inventory. She has been working at this business for 4 years, during which she has always fought for her and her children to stay afloat, despite the difficulties she has had to face, because she wants to be able to offer her children everything they need. She is very happy with her work because without it she would not have enough to eat every day. Her biggest dream is to increase her business and be more competitive.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Liliana Medaly

texts.es:
Liliana tiene 19 años de edad, es casada, tiene un hijo y vive junto a su esposo en casa de sus padres, ubicada en el caserío La Pava, distrito de Mochumí, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Debido a que los ingresos que su esposo percibe como agricultor no son suficientes para sustentar los gastos familiares. Se vió en la necesidad de iniciar hace algunos meses un negocio de comercialización de animales. Ella ya habia tenido experiencia en este rubro ya que anteriormente había ayudado a su madre en un negocio parecido.

Liliana compra animales (cerdos, aves de corral), los engorda y luego los comercializa en el mercado de la ciudad de Lambayeque o a los negociantes que eventualmente visitan su caserío. Ella se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de alimento balanceado para cerdos.

Su más grande anhelo es tener una casa propia y ofrecerle a su hijo una educacion de calidad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora y muy responsable.
texts.en:
Liliana is 19 years old, she is married and has a son, and she lives with her husband in her parents' home, located in the La Pava hamlet, Mochumí district, one hour away from Chiclayo city.

Given that the income her husband earns as a farmer is not enough to sustain the family, a few months ago she was forced to start an animal selling business. She had experience in this area because she had helped her mother in a similar business before.

Liliana buys animals (pigs, fowl), fattens them and then she sells them in Lambayeque's city market or to the traders that occasionally visit her hamlet. She finds herself asking Edpyme Alternativa for the first time for a 1,200.00 PEN loan which she intends to invest in the purchase of balanced feed for pigs.

Her greatest wish is to have a home of her own and to offer her son an education of quality. She is an enterprising and very responsible woman.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of balanced feed for pigs

loans.name: G.s Johana.- Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Johana está conformado por Rosa Argentina y Reina De Inglaterra. Ambas tienen diferentes actividades económicas. Doña Argentina se dedica a la venta de golosinas y frutas, y lo hace con mucho esfuerzo para mantener a su familia. Ella es una muy buena cliente y además le gusta su trabajo. Reina se dedica a la venta de frijoles cocidos. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a este negocio. En cambio Reina tiene 15 años que se dedica a este negocio pero le gustaría trabajar más horas y así generar ingresos para su familia. El financiamiento que solicitan es para capital de trabajo ya que ambos necesitan invertir en sus negocios. El sueño de ambas es salir adelante con sus negocios y lograr grandes mejorías en sus viviendas.
texts.en:
The community bank Johana is composed of Rosa Argentina and Reina de Inglaterra. They both have different economic activities. Ms. Argentina deals in sweets and fruits, and she works very hard to support her family. She is a very good seller and besides she likes her job. Reina sells cooked beans. Rosa Argentina has been working at this for over 8 years, while Reina has been working at this business for 15 years, but she would like to work more hours and thus generate an income for her family. The loan they request is for working capital, since they both need to invest in their business. The dream of both of them is to prosper in their business and manage big improvements in their homes.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Geronima Esperanza

texts.es: Geronima ha realizado varios financiamientos con Fundación León 2000, por lo que agradece la oportunidad que le brindaron en confiar en ella. Tiene la actividad económica de venta de tortillas cabe señalar que la señora trabaja muy fuertemente todos los días. Este negocio empezó hace 41 años con muy poco capital de trabajo, como una búsqueda de fuente de ingresos alternativos, después fue que empezó a invertir con el tiempo, por lo que ahora tiene su propia fama con sus tortillas.  El crédito será invertido en la compra de materia prima, ya que se acerca la época navideña y la señora desea invertir y materia prima. Su deseo es proporcionarle las mejoras necesarias a su negocio.
texts.en:
Geronima has fulfilled several loan cycles with Fundación León 2000, so she is grateful for the opportunity they gave her by trusting her. Her economic activity is selling tortillas. It should be noted that she works heavily every day. This business began 41 years ago with very little working capital, as a search for alternative income sources; later, she invested more into the business and now she and her tortillas are renowned. The loan will be invested in the purchase of raw materials, since the Christmas season is coming near, and she wants to make an investment and buy raw materials. Her wish is to give her business the improvements it needs.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion P. is from the village of Colupan Bajo, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 68 years old. Consolacion is married and has seven adult children. To make a living, Consolacion owns and operates a business venture selling food and operating a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from making and selling rice rolls called "suman" and selling a variety of products in her "sari-sari" store, or general store, in the local community. Consolacion has been engaged in her businesses for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month through these activities.

In 2008, Consolacion joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Consolacion has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to provide additional capital for her business. Consolacion is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Consolacion from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
La Señora Rene L. está sumamente agradecida por su cooperación en el crédito anterior con el cual su negocio a tenido más ingresos.
Está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para invertir en el negocio ya que le está haciendo falta mercancía y equipo nuevo de cocina, pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión y no quiere descapitalizar el negocio. 
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtendrá.
texts.en:
Ms. Rene L. is grateful to everybody who cooperated with her last loan thanks to which her business has increased its revenue. She asks for a new loan to invest in her business because she needs more merchandise and new cooking equipment, but at this moment she does not have the money needed for the investment an she does not want to decapitalise the business. She plans to pay back the loan with the money she will earn thanks to the investment she will make.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise and new cooking equipment

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie C. is from the village of Magsaysay, Baliangao, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Lenie owns and operates a business providing manicure and pedicure services in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Lenie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 2,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional materials for better service. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for better service

loans.name: Gwendolyn

texts.en:
Gwendolyn A. is from the village of Matipas Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old. Gwendolyn is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Gwendolyn raises pigs for sale. Gwendolyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Gwendolyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services and to help improve her living situation. It also allowed her the ability to engage in business activities. Gwendolyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional pigs to sell. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Gwendolyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional pigs to sell.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan R. está muy agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito. 
Nuevamente está solicitando un préstamo para poder pagarles a sus proveedores y así poder surtir de más materia prima. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias del negocio ya que es la fuente de ingresos de su familia.
texts.en:
Juna R. is so pleased with the past loan he had received. Currently he is seeking to have a loan to be able to pay his suppliers, allowing him to have access to more materials. He plans on taking some of the income he has earned from his business to pay the loan. His business is the only source of income for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay his suppliers.

loans.name: Portia

texts.en:
Portia P. is from the village of Magsaysay, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old, is married, and has two adult children. Portia owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily-use products such as food for snacks, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Portia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora P. is from the village of Magsaysay, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Nora owns and operates a general store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Nora joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ma. Heidi

texts.en:
Ma. Heide V. is 30 years old. She has six children and her eldest is only 12 and studying. Her wish for her children is that they will grow healthy and respectful.

Heide is a fish vendor and works from 6 a.m. until 6 p.m. to be able to sell fish and raise money for a living. She would like to apply for a loan of Php 13,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc to expand her fish selling business and also develop her farm.

If ever she gets a loan, she will buy the farm supplies needed in her farm aside from buying more fish to resell. The loan will not only improve her harvest in her farm but income as well in her fish selling business.

loans.use: To buy more fish to resell

loans.name: Ayurzana

texts.en: Ayurzana N. is 39 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Uvs province, one of Mongolia's western provinces. He has two daughters and two sons, of whom the oldest three children go to local secondary schools. Ayurzana owns a small car that he uses as a taxi in the town. He has been working as a taxi driver since 2007. Since there is almost no public transportation in the town, taxis are quite in demand and he is an experienced taxi driver. Due to health issues, he went to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia for hospital treatment and got back after seven months of treatment. Since then, he has been working hard and recently he sold his old car for profit and bought a bigger car in order to serve his customers better. He requests a loan to get his car serviced and to change the tires for better ones.

loans.use: To get his taxi serviced and purchase new tires

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma V. owns a small sari-sari store. She sells a variety of goods and earns an income for her family. She said that the greatest dream she has is for her children to graduate from college. She is working very hard to be the best mother for her two children. Her eldest child is 19 years old. She is doing the best she can to provide for all of her children's needs.

She would like to request a loan of Php 20,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. If she gets a loan, she will use it to buy farm supplies to grow a crop. In this way, she could earn a higher income to better support her family.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: Sen P., 45, is married and lives with her seven children and husband in Siem Reap Town, Cambodia. She is engaged in a business of selling various kinds of groceries at her home in her village with the help of her husband. P. has operated this business since 2008 and is able to earn an income of US $5 per day. P. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, P. is asking for a loan of US $500 to purchase more varieties of groceries to stock her store and to expand the current business. In the future, she hopes she will be able to open a big store for selling groceries. She also wants to build a nice new house for her family and send her children to good schools.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Lumanai

texts.en:
Lumanai M. is 35 and married with 5 children (ages 5 - 17).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Lumanai has many years of experience in this business.  Lumanai needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 tala or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2007, Lumanai joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Lumanai's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Lumanai M. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                2 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.6 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.6 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.6 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress.  The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation.  A higher number represents a higher score.  For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.  

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15"

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Peuy

texts.en: Peuy H., 45, is married and lives with her four school-aged children and husband in Siem Reap Town, Cambodia. She is engaged in a business of selling fish and vegetables in her village. H. has operated this business since 2008 and is able to earn an income of US$6 per day. Her husband is a driver for a private company in the town, earning an income of US$8 per day to help cover the family expenses. H. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, H. is asking for a loan of US$1,000 to purchase a motorbike to transport her fish and vegetables for sale in her village. She thinks that this expected loan will enable her to cut back on public transportation expenses and save more money. In the future, she hopes she will be able to make bigger improvements in her business. She also wants to build a nice new house for her family, and send her children to good schools.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport fish and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Dorjpalam

texts.en: Dorjpalam B. is 44 years old and lives with his wife and three teenage children in Arhangai Province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His oldest son is 19 years old and goes to a college in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The younger two daughters are 11 and 15 years old and go to local secondary schools. Dorjpalam started his small retail business with the capital of 30,000 Mongolian tugrugs (US$1 equals about 1,450 MNT) in 2006. He started his business by selling various dairy products including cheese, curds, and milk cream. Today, he rents a stall at the local black market and sells a greater variety of dairy products with an increased business capital of 3,000,000 MNT. Because he sells good quality products, he already has many loyal, regular local customers. He says that in his business, he has always prioritized customer satisfaction, which always follows good quality products and welcoming service. He has requested a loan to purchase more dairy products for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products

loans.name: Jerlie

texts.en:
Jerlie A. is from the village of Poblacion 4 Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years old. Jerlie is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Jerlie owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jerlie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jerlie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jerlie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jerlie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

Loisi needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 tala or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2007, Loisi joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Loisi's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.name: Lek

texts.en: Lek S., 32, is married and lives with her three school-aged children and husband in Siem Reap Town, Cambodia. She and her husband are engaged in a craft business, producing Cambodian traditional drums as souvenirs for tourists visiting the province. They have operated this business since 2000 and are able to earn an income of US $7 per day. S. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, S. is asking for a loan of US $800 to purchase a machine to help her in the craft. By doing so, she hopes that she will be able to produce more drums for her existing customers and generate more income. In the future, she hopes she will be able to expand her current crafting business and buy a trailer. She also wants to build a nice new house for her family and send her children to good schools.

loans.use: To buy a machine to help produce drums

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia D. is from the village of Villalin, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old. Delia is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Delia owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling ice candy (popsicles) in the local community. Delia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Delia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Delia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional raw materials for making ice candy. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Delia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials for making ice candy

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria P. is 23 and married with no children.  She owns a business venture, selling puletasi (Samoan formal wear).  Victoria has 2 years of experience in this business.  Victoria needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase additional equipment & tools such as needles & threads.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Victoria joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Victoria's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment & tools such as needles & threads

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene A., 37 years old, is a sari-sari store (variety store) owner. She sells a variety of goods like rice, soap, instant noodles, shampoo and other basic commodities in her store. She has many customers because she ensures quality service and affordable prices for all her merchandise. She has two children. Her eldest is only 11 years old and is graduating from elementary school.

She would like to request a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise to grow her sari-sari store business. She will also buy farm supplies for growing rice. If she gets a loan, she doesn't need to go elsewhere to find a job. She will just stay in their home and make the farm and her sari-sari store more productive.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Buural

texts.en: Buural B. is 51 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Uvs Province, one of Mongolia's western provinces. Buural's two oldest sons live and work in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, and the youngest son is serving in the national army. The youngest daughter is just two years old and stays home in the care of her mother. Buural has a small shoe-making business with his wife. He and his wife make traditional warm shoes for women and men. They usually sew five to seven pairs of shoes per month and locals like to wear their handcrafted quality shoes. His family also owns an old tractor that Buural uses in the spring and summer in order to earn some extra income for his family. Buural says that all his children except the twp-year-old have already grown up and are building their own lives. He would like to work hard and set aside some money to ensure his two-year-old daughter's future. He has requested a loan to purchase materials needed for making shoes.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed for making shoes

loans.name: Dorn

texts.en: Dorn U., 51, is married and lives with her two children and husband in Siem Reap Town, Cambodia. She and her husband are engaged in a business of selling firewood. They have operated this business since 1998 and are able to earn an income of US$2.5 per day. U. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, U. is asking for a loan of US$600 to purchase a motorbike for one of her children to commute to work in the town. This is her second loan from CREDIT, one of Kiva’s Field Partners. In the future, she hopes she will be able to open a souvenir shop for her children to earn an income on their own. She also wants to build a nice new house for her family, and to send her children to good schools. U. is pictured with her mother in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita Q. is from the village of Taganas. She is 49 years old. Teresita is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Teresita owns and operates a "sari-sari" (variety) store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Teresita is just starting this business. 

In 2002, Teresita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. This will be Teresita's 13th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha G. is a rice farmer. She owns a small field and hopes it will provide her family with enough income to buy an adequate supply of food, clothing and other basics. She has three children.  Editha is working very hard to be the best mother to her children. 

She would like to request a loan of Php 14,000 from community Economic Ventures Inc. to buy farm supplies. This will help her grow her crops and have an abundant harvest.

loans.use: Buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Byambajav

texts.en:
Byambajav S. is a married 48 year-old woman with six children, ranging in age from 13 to 25.  She lives with her children and husband in Uvs, one of Mongolia's furthest western provinces. Her two oldest children work, one sons is a herder in the countryside.  The others attend local schools. 

Byambajav and her husband run a small motel with a cafeteria on the main road.  She's run this business since 2000 and on average, one to three cars with about 20 people stop by everyday and eat lunch and/or dinner on the way to the Chinese border or to other towns. 

She says that because of the good lunch and dinner her cafeteria offers, she stays busy.  Byambajav requests a loan to purchase necessary food ingredients for her cafeteria business.

loans.use: Purchase food ingredients.

loans.name: Samalaulu

texts.en:
Samalaulu F. is 38 and married with 5 children.  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting bananas for sale.  Samalaulu has 6 years of experience in this business.  Samalaulu needs a loan of WST $2000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2007, Samalaulu joined SPBD.    This is her 3rd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Samalaulu's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Samalaulu F. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                         1.4 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:            1.8 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:                2.3 out of 3

The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora G. owns a rice field and a piggery business.  She farms and tills the land to provide food for her family. She raises pigs and sells them after four months.  Flora also operates a sari-sari (convenience) store, selling a variety of items in her village to supplement her income.

She would like a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. to buy farm supplies for her rice farm and to purchase additional merchandise for her sari-sari store that she can resell.

loans.use: Buy farm supplies and merchandise for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda L., 52, is a rice farmer from Sta. Josefa Agusan del Sur. She started her business in 1975 and tills her farm land hoping to have an abundant harvest.  She says it is really difficult because the farm needs enough capitalization to grow rice. 

She was happy to join CEVI and get access to small loans.  Now, she would like to apply for a loan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. to buy farm supplies to help grow a good crop.

loans.use: Buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn D., 41 years old, owns and manages a small rice farm in Santa Josefa Agusan del Sur. She has two children. Her eldest child is 20 years old and was not able to proceed to college because of financial difficulties. Evelyn wishes to grow her business so that she will have enough income to support all her family's needs.

She is hoping to receive a loan from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to increase the size of her harvest and her income.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia P. is engaged in rice farming and trading. She grows rice and sells her harvest for additional income for her family. She said her harvest is what she uses to buy her family food and provide for their basic needs. The farm is very important to her, especially because it is the only source of income for the family.

She is asking for a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan to buy the farm supplies she needs to grow her rice well. The loan will help not just to improve her harvest but to increase her family's income as well.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth A. manages a small rice field in Sta. Josefa, Agusan del Sur. Though she is just 35 years old, she is still capable of handling a business. She said that as she continues to work on the farm, she really needs additional capital. Farming is not easy, you need hard work and money to achieve your desired harvest, she said. 

She would like to apply for a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos from Community Economic Ventures Inc., a Kiva partner. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to increase her harvest. When she is already well established in her business, she dreams of buying more land to help her relatives.

loans.use: Farm supplies

She is asking for a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos from Community Economic Ventures, Inc., a Kiva partner. The loan will go far in buying farm supplies to double the size of her harvest.
