loans.name: Yen

texts.en: Yen Chentha, 34, is married and lives with his two school-aged children and wife in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. He is engaged in a business of selling ice-cream. He has operated this business since 2000 and is able to earn a gross income of US $36 per day. His wife is a grocery seller, earning a gross income of approximately US $12 per day to help cover the family expenses. Chentha and his family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, Chentha is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase more ice-cream and groceries for sale. This is his first loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. In the future, he hopes he will be able to a bigger business to save up more income. He also wants to build a new nice house for his family, and send his children to good schools.

loans.use: buy more ice-cream and groceries for sale

texts.en:
Arlyn B., 30, is a farmer in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. Her parents taught her everything she knows about planting rice and maintaining a good and quality harvest. Her farm is earning very well, but she admitted that she still needs additional capital to grow her business more. She joined the loan program of Community Economic Ventures, Inc., a Kiva partner. She likes the program very much, that is why she is still a member of the CEVI cluster association. 

She would like to apply for another loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos. She will use the loan to buy farm inputs and supplies. In this way, she believes she will be able to obtain a greater harvest and income for her family.

loans.use: Farm supplies

texts.en:

To make a living, San Rose makes and sells chicken and hotdog barbecue in the local community. San Rose has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, San Rose joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. San Rose is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase ingredients for her food. This will be San Rose's first loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15"

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Pioneta

texts.en:
Pioneta Garsenilla has experienced tremendous failure on her farm before. She thought that she would not able to recover, but CEVI helped her and gave her capital to start again and to sustain her business. The income she makes  from farming has helped her to buy food, clothing and other basic needs. 

She would like to request a loan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies so she can increase her harvest. When her income rises, she will be able to provide for her family and better supply of all their needs.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia T., age 44, has three children. Her eldest is 15 years old and studying in high school. She and her husband have been married for almost 16 years now. Lucia has a farm and she needs additional capital for her business.

She would like to request a loan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies. She likes the CEVI program because the interest rate on her loan is only 2% and she was able to buy insurance, too.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie I., age 39, is a rice farmer from Santa Josefa, Agusan del Sur. She says that her family really relieson her farm. Whatever income she makes from growing rice is a big help for the family, allowing them to buy food, clothing and other basic needs. 

She would like to request a loan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies so she can increase her harvest and raise her income.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa L., age 49, has a farm. She grows rice to help her family buy food, clothing, and other basic needs. She says that she has been a farmer since she was born. Her parents are farmers and all her life was spent on the farm. 

She would like to expand her business so she needs additional capital. She is requesting a loan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She plans to buy farm supplies so that she will be assured of a high-quality harvest and more income. The loan will truly help her to expand her business, as well.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla V. is 53 years old. She has a farm that she tills every day so she can buy food, clothes, and other basic needs. She is planning to expand her business so she needs a consistent, abundant harvest from her farm. Her family eats the rice from her harvest and then sells the excess to traders for income. 

She is hoping to receive a loan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies so she can expand her harvest and earn more income for her family.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie P., age 37, grows rice for a living. She chose rice as her main crop because it is a commodity and because everyone buys rice to eat. She has four children, the eldest of whom is 16 years old. She dreams that her children will graduate from college. She works so hard to become the best mother she can be to her children and to provide for their daily needs. 

She would like to request a loan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies. The loan will truly help her to increasing the size of her harvest and raise their family income.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky R. is from the village of Poblacion in Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old. Vicky is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Vicky grows and sells rice. Vicky has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000.00 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Vicky joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vicky has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5.000.00 PHP from GDMPC. Vicky is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. This will be Vicky's second loanfrom GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

 

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy L. is 39 years old. She has a 10-year-old child who always inspires her to work harder. She works very hard to become the best mother that she can be to her only child. She dreams of sending her child to college so that her child will be able to find better employment in the future. 

Now, she needs additional capital for her business. She would like to apply for a loan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. to fund her farm. The loan will help her to buy farm supplies to grow her crops.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Svay

texts.en: Svay S., 29, is married and lives with her seven-year-old child and husband in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. She is engaged in a business of providing security services to vehicles of people who come to a local hospital in the city. S. has operated this business since 2000 and is able to earn an income of US $4 per day. Her husband is employed as a staff for an organization, earning a monthly wage of US $38 per month. S. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, S. is asking for a loan of US $600 to continue renting the space for keeping vehicles near the hospital. With the remainder, she wants to buy morning glory seeds to grow and sell. This is her first loan from CREDIT MFI, Kiva’s partner. In the future, she hopes she will be able to build a new nice house for her family, and send her children to good schools.

loans.use: continue renting the space for keeping vehicles and buy seeds

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie G., age 39, owns a small parcel of farmland. She has two children, the eldest of whom is 15 years old. She wanted to support her children's education until college, which is why she is working so hard to save money for the future. 

She would like to request a loan of Php 15000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies so she can increase her harvest and generate enough income to support her family.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida R. is from the village of Inasagan in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 33 years old. Nida is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Nida raises and sells pigs. Nida has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2008, Nida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. She used her previous loan to buy piglets to raise and sell. Nida is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be Nida's sixth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

 

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn P. is a 31-year-old rice farmer who is married to a farmer. They live in Santa Josefa, Agusan del Sur. She and her husband are childless. They dream that, some day, they will have children in their house. They also dream of having bigger farm to meet the needs of their family.

She would like to request a loan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies. The loan will truly help in her business operations. Through this loan, she will be able to ensure a high-quality harvest and more income.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.en:
Vanessa V. is 30 years old and has three children. Her eldest is only 8 years old and is currently studying in the elementary grades. She is a farmer who owns a small parcel of farmland in Santa Josefa, Agusan del Sur. 

Now she is busy preparing the soil for another planting season. She would like to request a loan of Php 15,000 to buy the farm supplies she needs. The loan will truly help her sustain her business and ensure the healthy growth of her crops. With this loan, she will have a better harvest and income to support her family.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Noella

texts.en:
Noela A. is 46 and married with 8 children (ages 1 - 24).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Noela has many years of experience in this business.  Noela needs a loan of WST $1300 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Noela joined SPBD.  This is her 3rd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Noela's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Noela A. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.87 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15"

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guilerma F. is a 49-year-old resident of Santa Josefa, Agusan del Sur. She has a farm and rice is her main crop. The income she makes from her farm helps to buy her family an adequate supply of food, clothing and other basic needs. The Income also has helped to pay for the daily expenses in their home.

She would like to expand her business, but she need additional capital. She would like to request a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. to buy farm supplies for her business.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma P., age 31, dreams of a better life for her family. She is working so hard to improve her harvest and support her family. Alma started to till her rice farm in 1996. She says that her farm needs capital, especially to buy seeds and pay for labor.

She is asking for a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies so she can have an abundant harvest and more income.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn F. is 28 years old and a young farmer. She lives in Santa Josefa, Agusan del Sur. She started her business since 1998. She was interested in rice farming, because knows how to grow rice and people are buy it as a commodity. 

Roselyn needs additional capital for her business. She would like to apply for a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures inc. to buy farm supplies. The loan will improve her harvest and her income.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma O. is 19 years old and has a farm. She says that, when she started her business, she failed because she was not familiar with managing a rice farm. Through experience, she has gained knowledge. Now, she needs additional capital to run and sustain her business. 

She is hoping to receive a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies so that she can increase her harvest. Her family relies on the income of the farm, so she is doing her best to make it productive.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Ofu

texts.en:
Ofu V. is 50 and married with 7 children (ages 20 - 35).  She owns a business venture, selling both food & daily use products in the local community.  Ofu has many years of experience in this business.  Ofu needs a loan of WST $2500 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2005, Ofu joined SPBD.    This is her 4th loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Ofu's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Ofu V. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.9 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.4 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.5 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15"

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta E. is from the village of Magsaysay in Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Julieta is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Julieta owns and operates a general store where she sells daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste, in the local community. Julieta has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Julieta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Julieta's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kul

texts.en:
Kul Y. is 50 years old. She is married and lives with her husband in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. She and her husband are engaged in the agriculture sector, growing morning glories and other types of vegetables. They have been involved in farming since 1998 and are able to each earn an income of USD 7 per day.

Y. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, Y. is asking for a loan of USD 600 to purchase more seeds to grow morning glory and other types of vegetables. She thinks that her business will improve, since she has many existing customers and middle men who buy her vegetable products. This is her first loan from CREDIT MFI, Kiva’s partner. In the future, she hopes she will be able to build a nice new house for her family and send her children to good schools.

loans.use: To buy seeds

loans.name: Pab

texts.en:
Pab B., age 33, is a rice farmer from Santa Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. He maintains a hectare (2.5-acres) of farmland and grows rice to feed his family and supply their basic needs. He has three children, the eldest of whom is only 8 years old and studying in the elementary grades. 

He is looking for an opportunity to expand his business and joined the Community Economic Ventures Inc (CEVI) credit program just this year. If he gets a loan, Pab will use the money to buy farm supplies. He is asking for a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. He likes the CEVI program, especially the 2% interest rate.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Svay

texts.en:
Svay S. is 27 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and their four-year-old child in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. She and her husband are engaged in the agriculture sector, growing morning glories and other types of vegetables. They have been involved in farming since 1999 and are able to each earn an income of USD 7 per day. 

S. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, S. is asking for a loan of USD 600 to purchase more seeds to grow morning glory. She thinks that her business will improve, since she has many existing customers and middle men who buy her vegetable products. This is her first loan from CREDIT MFI, Kiva’s partner. In the future, she hopes she will be able to build a nice new house for her family and send her children to good schools.

loans.use: To buy seeds

loans.name: Chham

texts.en: Chham C., 24, is married and lives with a four-year-old child and his wife in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. He and his wife are engaged in the agriculture sector, growing morning glories and other types of vegetables. He is also a skillful fisherman. Both C. and his wife have been involved in these businesses since 2000 and are able to earn an income of US $6 per day each. C. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, C. is asking for a loan of US $600 to purchase more seeds to grow morning glory. He thinks that his business will be improved since there are many existing customers and middlemen to buy his vegetable products. This is his first loan from CREDIT MFI, Kiva’s partner. In the future, he hopes he will be able to build a new nice house for his family, and to send his child to good schools.

loans.use: To buy morning glory seeds.

loans.name: María

texts.es: María I. S. de 49 años de edad, reside en el municipio de San Martín, en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a sus dos hijos y su madre. Ella posee una pequeña librería desde hace ocho años, y cuenta con muy buena clientela debido a que es la única librería en las cercanías del lugar, lo cual es una gran ventaja para ella. María solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más material para su negocio como cuadernos, lápices, borradores, mayor cantidad de papelería y otros productos más. María desea poder aprovechar la temporada de inicio de clases la cual es en el mes de enero, es por ello que tiene mucha ilusión de surtir su negocio en esto días, así podrá comprar al por mayor y de esta manera obtener los productos a un precio menor, lo cual le permitirá ofrecer sus productos a un precio menor y que las personas la prefieran a la hora de comprar sus útiles escolares.
texts.en:
Maria I. Serran is 49 years old and she lives in the San Martin municipality in El Salvador. She lives together with her two children and her mother. She has been running a small school supply store for the past eight years and she has earned a good client base because hers is the only supply store in the area. Maria is requesting a loan so that she will be able to purchase more merchandise, such as notebooks, pencils, errasers, greater quantities of office supplies and other items. Maria wants to take advantage of back to school in January. She will be able to sell her products at a better price and especially because people prefer to purchase their school supplies ahead of time.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase school supplies.

loans.name: Andrea Margarita

texts.es: Andrea Margarita J. D. L. D. 37 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Ilopango en el departamento D. San Salvador, vive junto a su esposo y su hijo. Ella posee una venta D. lácteos como queso y crema. Andrea tiene 8 años D. poseer su negocio, sus vecinos la reconocen como una mujer muy dedicada, responsable y amable, lo cual le permite a ella que las personas la prefieran a la hora D. comprar lácteos. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda compra mayor cantidad D. queso y crema, así mismo Andrea desea poder ampliar su negocio, comprando aceite, granos básicos y cosméticos, todo esto lo hace con el fin D. poder obtener mayores ganancias y así mismo tener una vida mejor para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Andrea Margarita Jimenez D. Lopez is 37 years old, she lives in the municipality of Ilopango in El Salvador. She lives together with her husband and their son. She has a dairy store, selling cheese and cream. Andrea has been running her business for the past 8 years, and she is known as a very dedicated, responsible and amicable person, the reason why people prefer her business for their dairy products. She is requseting a loan to purchase larger quantities of cheeses and creams. She would also like to expand her business and start providing cooking oil, basic grains, and cosmetics. She is doing everything so that she will improve her revenues and to have a better life for her family and for herself.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic grains and cooking oil.

loans.name: Roz Group

texts.en:
The name of this group is Roz. It has three members: Bebe Gul, Karima and Mastora. Bebe Gul is the group leader. She is 39 years old, married, and has 6 children. Her husband has a cart from which he sells onions and potatoes. She would like to take a loan to progress her business and to buy more vegetables to sell, along with the other items. This would allow her to sell more and to have a good income.

The second member, Karima, would like to take the loan for her husband’s general store. The loan will be used to buy items that are not currently available in his shop, but are in demand in the market. 

The last member, Masooda, would like to take the loan for her brother who has a Bolani (a kind of Afghani dish) selling cart. With the loan she would like to purchase more oil and flour ingredients to attract more clients and to add to his monthly income as well.

They have requested a group loan, together, of 30000 Afghani.

loans.use: For purchasing necessay materials for their businesses.

loans.name: Ana Gertrudis

texts.es: Ana Gertrudis M. D. C. D. 31 años D. edad, resiD. en Jiquilisco en el departamento D. Usulután. Vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos D. 12, 8 y 4 años D. edad, los cuales estudian. Ella posee una venta en el mercado municipal D. Jiquilisco, en la cual venD. granos básicos, mantas, canastas y otros productos más. Ella ha trabajado durante 8 años teniendo este negocio y ahora desea poder surtirlo con más productos D. primera necesidad. Ana es una mujer muy trabajadora la cual se esfuerza mucho para poder brindarle ayuda a su esposo y que D. esta manera no haga falta nada en el hogar ni a sus hijos. Es por ello que es D. mucha importancia poder mejorar las ventas generadas por su negocio, ya que ha sido gracias a este que hasta ahora ha podido brindarle ayuda a su esposo. Ana solicita un prestamo a traves del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. productos varios para poder surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana Gertrudis Mejia D. Caceres is 31 years old, she lives in Jiquilisco in Usulutan. She lives together with her husband and their three children, aged 12, 8 and 4 years old. They are all going to school. She runs a stand in the municipal market of Jiquilisco, selling basic grains, cloaks, baskets and other products. For the past eight years she has been running her business and now she would like to increase the selection to incluD. more basic needs products. Ana is a very hard working woman and struggles to support her husband with the expenses, so that their children will not be in need of anything. For this reason she places such high importance of improving her revenues. Ana is requesting a loan to be able to purchase a greater variety of products, to increase the selection in her business.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase home merchandise.

loans.name: Ngô's Group

texts.en:
C. Ngô Thị (20209050043) is a 53-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong-Bắc Ninh. C. is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Vọng Nguyệt 3 nhóm 01 (1).

C. is married and has three grown children. To make a living, C. owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector: it is a specialized retail store. While not her only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling confectionary products in the local community. C. has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, C. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. C. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,808,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,048,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be C.'s third loan taken out from SEDA.  C. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Nguyễn Thị Sử (20209050044) is a 56-year-old female who is requesting a 5,600,000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a tailoring business.

2.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20209050045) is a 28-year-old female who is requesting a 5,600,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

3.  Nguyễn Thị V. (20209050046) is a 35-year-old female who is requesting a 5,600,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food.

4.  Trương Thị T. T. (20209050047) is a 29-year-old female who is requesting a 5,600,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

C. Ngô Thị (20209050043) là 53 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  C. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Vọng Nguyệt 3 nhóm 01 (1).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên T. nhập, mà nguồn T. nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm bánh kẹo trong cộng đồng địa phương.  C. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, C. kiếm được khoảng 2.500.000 VND.  Vào 2008, C. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  C. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.808.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.048.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  Nguyễn Thị Sử (20209050044) là 56 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.600.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc.

2.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20209050045) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.600.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

3.  Nguyễn Thị V. (20209050046) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.600.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

4.  Trương Thị T. T. (20209050047) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.600.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung T. hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có T. nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc V. Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.es: Eufemia G. M. de 55 años de edad, reside en Guatajiagua ubicado en el departamento de Morazán. Vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijas, las cuales le ayudan en el negocio, así mismo vive junto a dos nietos. Ella posee un negocio en el cual se dedica a elaborar jarrones, comales y otros productos más, elaborados a base de barro o losa, estos son productos muy típicos de la cultura salvadoreña los cuales se utilizan para la cocina. Eufemia posee muy buena clientela y cuenta con lugares en diferentes departamento del país en los cuales vende sus productos al por mayor. Es por esto que ella solicita un préstamo, a través del cual pueda comprar la materia prima para la elaboración de su trabajo, materia como barro, losa y leña, esta última la utiliza para cocer el barro. Ella espera poder aumentar su capital de trabajo para poder comprar más material y de esta manera poder aceptar más trabajo ya que hasta ahora esto le ha sido difícil porque no cuenta con el dinero necesario para hacerlo.
texts.en:
Eufemia Gonzalez Martinez is 55 years old and shel ives in Guatajiagua located in Morazan. She lives together with her husband and their two daughters, both of whom help her run the business, and two grandchildren. She sells ceramic jugs, grills and other ceramic and clay products, very typical in the Salvadoran culture. Eufemia enjoys a good client base and she sells to different regions of the country on a wholesale basis. She is requesting a loan to purchase more materials for her business, such as clay, ceramic and wood for firing. She hopes to improve the working capital to purchase more material. She will be able to accept larger orders, something she has had trouble with because she didn't have the funds to be able to fill the orders.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clay and other materials.

loans.name: María

texts.es: María L. T., reside en Colón departamento de La Libertad, vive junto a su esposo y una hija la cual trabaja para sus propios gastos. María L. se dedica a coser ropa para niños, mujeres y hombres, realiza su trabajo desde su propia casa y cuenta con muy buenas referencias por ser una persona que realiza su trabajo lo mejor posible, así mismo porque entre las prendas de vestir a tiempo y cose a muy buenos precios. Ella solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar hilo, telas y repuestos  para su máquina de coser. María desea poder seguir adelante con su negocio, ya que es este el que le permite poder solventar todas sus necesidades, así mismo es a través de este como pudo sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María L. T. lives in Colón, in the region of La Libertad, with her husband and their daughter, who is employed. María works as a tailor; she sews clothing for men, women and children. María works from her home and because she works quickly and does good work for a good price, she gets plenty of referrals. She has asked for a loan so that she can buy thread, fabric and parts for her sewing machine. María wants nothing more than to continue her work, and this loan will allow her to meet some of her business needs and also help her provide for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying thread, fabric and sewing machine parts

loans.name: Isabel Dinora

texts.es: Isabel Dinora F. A. de 41 años de edad, reside en Ciudad Arce, departamento de La Libertad, vive junto a su esposo y dos nietos los cuales dependen de ella. Isabel posee una venta de tortillas y una tienda en la cual comercializa productos varios como: gas propano granos básicos y golosinas. Dinora solicita un préstamo a través de cual pueda comprar maíz para la elaboración de más tortillas, ya que cerca de su casa hay una fábrica y los trabajadores de éste lugar van a comprar las tortillas donde ella. Así mismo desee poder surtir la tienda con productos como bebidas enlatadas, gaseosas, pan y otro productos más los cuales le permitirán aumentar sus ventas y de esta manera poder brindarles a sus nietos todo lo necesario, así mismo contribuir junto a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Isabel Dinora A. F. is 41 years old and lives in Arce City, La Libertad with her husband and two of their grandchildren, whom they care for. Isabel owns a tortilla stand and a shop that sells products like propane gas, grain and candy. Isabel will use her loan to buy corn for making tortillas. There's a factory near her house, and the workers like to stop by for tortillas. She also wants to stock her shop with canned drinks, sodas, bread, and anything else that might help her increase her sales. She hopes this loan will help her provide for her grandchildren, and allow her to help her husband with their other household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying corn and perishable goods

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Marta Enma

texts.es: Marta Enma L. A. de 50 años de edad, reside en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos. Ella posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos perecederos  y de primera necesidad. Marta cuenta con muy buena ubicación y es esto lo cual le permite contar con más cantidad de clientes, los cuales la prefieren por ser una persona muy amable. Marta desea poder surtir su negocio, comprando productos nuevos como golosinas, pasta dental y otros más. Marta desea poder aumentar sus ventas, ya que es esta la única fuente de ingresos que ella tiene para poder brindarle a su familia todo lo necesario para tener una vida aceptable en la cual se cuente con lo más básico.
texts.en:
Marta Enma L. A. is 50 years old and lives in the department of La Libertad. She lives with her husband and three children. She has a store in which she sells perishables and basic necessities. Marta is blessed with a good location, and she has many customers who prefer her because she is very friendly. Marta would like to expand her business, buying new products like sweets, toothpaste, and others. Marta wants to increase her sales, as this is the only source of income she has to provide her family with everything they need for an acceptable life.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase perishable goods

loans.name: Bebe Liala Group

texts.en:
This is Bebe Liala group. It is made up of five members. They all would like to expand their business and progress as well. Together, they have requested a group loan of 50000 Afghani.

Jamila is the group leader. She is a beautician. She has got a small beauty salon where most of her clients come. She would like to expand her business and to buy some more chairs and good quality cosmetics for her salon. This is why she has requested for a loan, to complete the necessities of her business.

The second member, Nadia, wants to take a loan for her husband’s mobile selling shop. With the loan, he would like to expand his business.

The third member is Zamir A., a hard working boy. With the loan he receives, he would buy more mobile seats for his shop.

Sheba, another member of this group, would like to purchase materials to design more beautiful things from beads.

Bebe Liala wants to take a loan for her tailoring business. With the loan, she wants to buy a new sewing machine. 

They are all thankful to the Kiva lenders from their support.

loans.use: For purchasing necessary materials for businesses

loans.name: Amparo Noemí

texts.es: Amparo Noemí  M. A. de 43 años de edad, reside en Jayaque, departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Ella posee una tienda de productos perecederos, la cual deja muy buenas ganancias, ya que es la única tienda que se encuentra en el lugar. Es por esto que Amparo desea poder comprar más productos, ya que ella sabe que su tienda cuenta con muy buena demanda y al surtirla más, mayores serán sus ganancias. Amparo solicita un préstamo a través de cual pueda comprar productos como granos básicos, embutidos, leche en polvo, café y otras cosas más. Para ella es de mucha importancia mejorar las ganancias ya que esto le permitirá darle una mejor vida a sus hijos y así mismo le permitirá pagarle los estudios universitarios, ya que uno de los mayores sueños para ella y su esposo es ver a sus hijos como profesionales con posibilidades de un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Amparo Noemí M. A. is 43 years old and lives in Jayaque in the department of La Libertad. She lives with her husband and their two children, who are both studying. She has a store where she sells perishable goods, which gives her a very good income as it is the only store in the area. Amparo would like to buy more products because she knows her store has strong demand, and if she expands, her income will grow. Amparo is seeking a loan so she can buy goods like grains, sausages, powdered milk, coffee, and other things. It is very important to her to increase her income as it allows her to provide a better life for her children and will also allow her to pay for their university studies. One of her and her husband's big dreams is to see their children grow up to be professionals with opportunities for a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic necessities

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: Ángela G. M. de 49 años de edad, reside en Colón, departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como constructor,  y sus tres hijos, los cuales son estudiantes. Ángela posee una tienda de productos perecederos, la cual esta ubicada en su propia casa. Desde hace dos años ella ha trabajado mucho por lograr mejorar las condiciones de su negocio ya que su mayor deseo es poder tener una tienda muy surtida, la cual las personas prefieran. Ángela solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar todos los productos necesarios para obtener  mayores ganancias. Ella junto a su esposo se esfuerzan día con día para poder llevar el sustento diario y de esta manera poder darles una vida mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ángela G. M. is 49 years old and lives in Colón in the department of La Libertad. She lives with her husband, who is a builder, and their three children, who are students. Ángela has a store where she sells perishable goods, which is located in her house. For the past two years, she has worked hard to improve the conditions of her business. Her wish is to have a well stocked store that is preferred by all. Ángela is seeking a loan in order to buy all the products necessary to obtain a better income. She and her husband work hard day after day to increase their standard of living and thus give their children a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic necessities

loans.name: Mirian Concepción

texts.es: Mirian Concepción A. D. T. D. 51 años D. edad resiD. en Jiquilisco, departamento D. Usulután. Vive junto a sus cuatro hijos menores D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Ella posee una tortillería en su propia casa, lugar al cual las personas llegan a comprar las tortillas, así mismo sus hijos le ayudan a repartirlas D. casa en casa a las personas que hacen los encargos. Ella solícita un préstamo para poder comprar maíz para la elaboración D. tortillas, esto debido a que cuenta con una gran demanda y muchas veces no pueD. atenderla toda debido a que se queda sin la masa, la cual esta hecha a base D. maíz. Mirian cuenta con 20 años D. realizar el mismo trabajo, el cual lo aprecia mucho ya que es gracias a este que ella logra darles una vida mejor a sus hijos, por ello ella desea seguir adelante con la tortillería, ya que es madre soltera y debe trabajar por cuatro hijo los cuales depenD. únicamente D. ella.
texts.en:
Mirian Concepción A. D. T. is 51 years old. She lives in Jiquilisco, in the Usulután region. Her four young children are all in school. Mirian has a tortilla stand in her home. People stop by to purchase tortillas, but her children also help distribute orders to other houses. Mirian will use her loan to buy corn, which she uses to make tortillas. She gets plenty of orders, but sometimes she runs out of dough. Mirian has been in this line of work for 20 years, and she greatly appreciates this loan. It will allow her to give her children a better life. She needs to continue operating her tortilla stand because she is a single mother and her four children are completely dependent on her.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying corn

loans.name: Gladis Orbelina

texts.es: Gladis Orbelina M. G. de 23 años de edad, reside en Cantón El Tronconal ubicado en el departamento de Chalatenango. Vive junto a sus padres y su pequeña hija de 3 años de edad. Gladis posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos perecederos y de primera necesidad. Dicho negocio lo inicio hace tres años cuando nació su bebé, debido a que es madre soltera, razón por la cual se vio en la necesidad de emprender su propio negocio, todo inspirado en su pequeña hija, la cual es el motor que la impulsa a seguir adelante. Gladis solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más productos para la tienda, ya que ella desea poder obtener mayores ganancias, debido a que su hija empezará a estudiar el próximo año, por lo cual Gladis necesita contar con el capital necesario para comprar los útiles escolares.
texts.en:
Gladis Orbelina M. G., 23, lives in Cantón El Tronconal, which is located in the Chalatenango department. She lives with her parents and her small three year old daughter. Gladis has a store where she sells perishable basic needs products. She started the business three years ago when her baby was born. Because she is a single mother, she saw the need to undertake her own business. It was all inspired by her small daughter, who is the motor that drives her to get ahead. Gladis is asking for a loan to be able to buy more products for her store. She wants to be able to get greater earnings because her daughter will start school next year. Gladis needs to have the money to buy the school supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy perishable products

location.town: Cantón El Tronconal, departamento de Chalatenango

loans.name: Mkwalia Group

texts.en:
Maulid K., age 55, is married and has six children. He has had a general store since 2001 and he is able to earn a monthly profit of around $72.

This will be Maulid’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He hopes to obtain a loan to expand his business.

Maulid will share this loan with his loan group, Mkwalia, which has 17 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. In the picture, Maulid is third from the right, in a green shirt.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Jaime Antonio

texts.es: Jaime Antonio R. G. de 37 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Sonsonate. Vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. El posee una venta de ropa para hombres y mujeres, la cual es la única fuente de ingresos que esta familia tiene, su esposa y su hijo mayor le ayudan a Jaime atender el negocio cuando el tiene que salir a comprar más mercadería. Jaime solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de ropa, de diferentes tallas, estilos y colores, todo lo que este de moda para poder atraer a más clientes, así mismo Jaime desea poder  aprovechar los últimos días del mes de diciembre, ya que es una de las fechas del año en que más se vende. Durante 10 años Jaime a trabajado por seguir adelante con su negocio y gracias a el préstamo solicitado, el espera lograr mejorar las condiciones de este.
texts.en:
Jaime Antonio R. G., 37, lives in the Sonsonate department. He lives with his wife and their three minor children. The children go to school. He has a business selling clothes for men and women. It is the only source of income that the family has. His wife and oldest child help Jaime take care of the business when he has to leave to buy more merchandise. Jaime is asking for a loan to be able to buy a greater quantity of clothes of different sizes, styles, and colors. He wants to buy everything that is in style to be able to attract more customers. Jaime wants to be able to take advantage of the last days in December, because that is the time of year when he sells the most. Jaime has worked for ten years to get ahead with his business. Thanks to the requested loan he hopes to improve the conditions of his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a greater variety of clothes

loans.name: Ana Melisa

texts.es: Ana Melisa R. N. de 41 años de edad, reside en San José Villanueva, departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo el cual de dedica a trabajar como agricultor y sus cuatro hijos, los cuales son estudiantes. Ana Melisa posee una venta de tortillas, las cuales las hace y vende en la medio día y en la noche, ella ha obtenido muy buenas ganancias gracias a este negocio durante mucho años, ahora ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda obtener el capital necesario para poder comprar mayor cantidad de maíz para la elaboración de la masa para las tortillas. El mayor desea de Ana es el de poder mejorar las ventas, ya que esto beneficia a su familia debido a que ella cuenta con el dinero para poder solventar los gastos del hogar junto con su esposo, el cual tiene un trabajo muy duro.
texts.en:
Ana Melisa R. N., 41, lives in San José Villanueva in the La Libertad department. She lives with her husband, a farmer, and their four children. The children go to school. Ana Melisa has a business selling tortillas. She makes them and sells them at midday and in the evening. She has received good income for many years thanks to this business. She is now asking for a loan to be able to get the necessary capital to buy a greater quantity of corn to make the dough for the tortillas. Ana’s biggest wish is to be able to improve sales. This will benefit her family because she counts on the money to be able to pay the household expenses together with her husband. He has a very hard job.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn

location.town: San José Villanueva, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Zadran Group

texts.en:
This is the Zadran group, which is made up of five members. They have requested a group loan of 70,000 Afghani. Shah Peki is the group leader.

Shah Peki, Ashat Ropia and Naz Bar all would like to use the loan for their tailoring business. These three members have a tailoring business where they sew Afghani national clothes in a nice way. They are all happy about their business and with the loan they would like to purchase new electric sewing machines which will help them work in a better way.

Qand Agha would like to take out a loan for his cart in which he sells second-hand clothes for children, and Bashir A. wants to take out a loan for the business of selling clothes in his shop. They all would like to expand their businesses and solve their problems as well. They all thank the Kiva lender a lot.

loans.use: Purchasing needed materials

loans.name: Ene's Group

texts.en:
Ene L. is 38 and married with 2 children (ages 3 and 12).  She owns a business venture, selling lavalavas (bottom-half wrap-around prints worn by both men and women).  Ene has 4 years of experience in this business.  Ene needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional fabrics & materials.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Ene joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Ene's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Ene L. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.87 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15"

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Fermina De Los Ángeles

texts.es: Fermina de los Ángeles A. R. de 34 años de edad, reside en San Juan Opico, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su hermana, su pequeña hija de 6 años de edad y sus sobrinos. Ella posee una venta de cosméticos y perfumes, los cuales los comercializa de manera ambulante, ya que va de casa en casa ofreciendo sus productos. Ella compra al contado, es por esto que solicita un préstamo para poder comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería ya que en muchas ocasiones sus clientes le piden algún tipo de productos y para ella es imposible obtenerlo debido a que no cuenta con el capital necesario para poder comprarlo, así mismo por el tipo de trabajo que posee y a las personas a la cuales les vende su producto muchas veces se ve en la necesidad de dar los cosméticos y perfumes a crédito, dinero el cual ella debe reponer. Fermina trabaja arduamente por el bienestar de su hija, ya que es ella la única que provee para los gastos de la niña.
texts.en:
Fermina de los Ángeles A. R. is 34 years old and lives in San Juan Opico, located in the department of La Libertad. She and her six-year-old daughter live with her sister and her children. She sells cosmetics and perfumes as a street vendor, going from house to house offering her products. She buys her merchandise on a retail basis. She is asking for a loan to be able to buy more inventory since often her customers ask her for a particular item and she can't get it since she doesn't have enough capital. She is also asking for a loan because given the nature of her job and her customer base, many customers need to make their purchases using credit, something she doesn't have the funds to offer. Fermina works hard for the well-being of her daughter since she is her sole provider.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics and perfumes

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Lyndie

texts.en:
Lyndie D. is from the village of Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Lyndie is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Lyndie owns and operates a business raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Lyndie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lyndie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lyndie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional feed. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lyndie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her general living conditions.

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock feed

loans.name: Nghiêm's Group

texts.en:
Nghiêm Thị B. is a 43-year-old woman living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. B. is the group leader for a two-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Ngô Nội nhóm 02.

B. is married and has three adult children. To making a living, B. operates a family member's manufacturing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing and selling bamboo products to local businesses and community members. B. has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, B. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. B. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,704,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,048,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings. The loan will be the third loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA. B. plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand the business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

Nghiêm Thị T. is a 41-year-old woman who is requesting a 4,704,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

B. Nghiêm Thị là 43 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. B. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 2 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Ngô Nội nhóm 02 (2).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán các sản phẩm bằng tre cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương. B. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, B. kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND. Vào 2008, B. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. B. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.704.000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên liệu thô để sản xuất các sản phẩm bổ sung. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.048.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1. Nghiêm Thị T. là 41 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.704.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Faalolo

texts.en:
Faalolo A. is 52 and married with 2 children (ages 29 and 37).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Faalolo has 4 years of experience in this business.  Faalolo needs a loan of WST $2000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2005, Faalolo joined SPBD.    This is her 3rd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Faalolo's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Faalolo A. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.87 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15"

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.name: Islamudin

texts.en:
This young man is Islamudin, the son of N.. He is 32 and married. He has two children, a son and a daughter, and both of them are school students. 
He is a hard working man who really works to support his wife and his children. 
He is a well digger. He works and digs the wells with the help of a machine. 
He would like to take an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani to buy the essential equipment needed to progress and expand his business.
He would like to extend his gratitude to all lenders, especially Kiva lenders, who support the entrepreneurs around Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy essential equipment for his business

To make a living, Glomer owns & operates a business selling fruit salad and ice drops to the local community. Glomer has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Glomer joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Mrs. Minda A. is 47 years of age and a resident of Upper Pisaan, Bonifacio. She has five adult children who are all married. Her partner is a farmer and coconut-plantation caretaker.

Minda currently runs a sari-sari or general store which she has operated for the last three years. She earns an average net income of P4,000 from her store sales, as well as from her sales of roasted banana, a snack locally known as "ginanggang".

Minda joined Paglaum MPC this year and this is her first loan. She joined PMPC because she was interested in the various services and products offered, particularly after PMPC won the “Most Outstanding Cooperative” award in the Philippines during the COOP-LGU Partnership Competition in 2006.

Minda plans to use her loan as additional capital for her store. She is looking forward to becoming an active member of the PMPC community.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

location.town: Upper Pisaan, Bonifacio, Mis. Occ. Mindanao

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia D., 58, is not a computer techie but she knows how to run a computer rental station.  Married to Ferdinand D. and blessed with three children, she makes it a point to balance her role as a mother, a wife and a businesswoman. 

Ofelia has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than two years now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow eight times in CCT’s Cooperative.  The reason why she was consistent in paying her loans was that she used almost all the money she borrowed to invest in her computer rental business. With the help of her business, she and her husband now earn PHP 70,000 net income per month. They also have two employees working for them.  

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 12,000 loan. This amount will be used mostly as a source of added capital for her expanding business. She will buy upgraded computer accessories to provide additional services for her clients. The extra profit that she will receive from this loan will be used for her children’s school expenses and to improve the quality of her family's life.

She dreams that her computer rental business will continue to grow and that life will be more blessed through the years. 


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy upgraded computer accessories

Beverlyn has been a rice farmer since 2000. She tills a 2-hectare piece of land in South Cotabato. She has been married to Jimmy and has two children. The eldest child is 18 years old. With rice farming, she has been able to provide the basic needs of her family.

She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to obtain a loan for her farm. She requested 15,000 PHP to buy fertilizer and farm supplies. She is thankful that CEVI only charges a low interest rate.

Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Phù Lưu 1 nhóm 03 (2).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 2.500.000 VND.  Vào 2007, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  T. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.808.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thức ăn gia súc & các loại cung cấp khác.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.496.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị C. (20211030009) là 62 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.496.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Nguyễn Thị D. (20211030014) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.496.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  Nguyễn Thị S. (20211030007) là 30 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.840.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


4.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20211030011) là 30 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.496.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en: Nhem P., 64, is married and lives with her five children and husband in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. She is a housewife, who stays at home and looks after her children and family. To make a living, her husband is employed in a local private company, earning an income of US $3 per day to help cover their family expenses. P. and her family members are seeking to improve their standards of living and generate a better income. Therefore, P. is asking for a loan of US $1200 to purchase a motorbike for one of her children, to commute to work. She thinks that this expected loan to buy a motorbike will enable her family to cut back on their public transportation expenses. This is her first loan from CREDIT MFI, Kiva’s partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for commuting to work

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn owns and manages a 3-hectare rice field in South Cotabato. She sought financial help from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to improve her farm. She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase farm inputs. 

Evelyn is already 54 years old with seven children. She wants to improve her way of living and sustain her family. The loan will be very helpful to maximize the needs of her farm for a better harvest in the future.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Loida

texts.en: Loida C. is from the "barangay" (village) of Maular, a village located in Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Loida owns and operates a sari-sari (general) store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Loida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Loida is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Fely

texts.en: Fely is 58 years and has a rice farming business. She started her business in 2005. This is the only way she can provide for the needs of her family. She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. in June 2008 to obtain a loan for additional capital for her business. Now she's asking 15,000 PHP to continue managing her business. This loan will of great help to purchase fertilizer for her farm.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Matea

texts.en: Matea T. is from the village of Becor, Taboo, Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old, is married, and has five school-aged children. Matea owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling various food products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Matea joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Mr. Touch M. lives in Krang Sbaek village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. He is also a duck breeder. His wife, Mrs. Em Khen, is a Khmer cake maker. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, Mr. Touch M. decided to request a loan to buy an iron pot for his wife’s business. Additionally, he would use the rest of money to buy duck food to support his poultry business. He is 48 years old and the father of four children. One of the children is employed in a garment factory, one sells Khmer cakes and the others attend the local school. His wife is presented in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy an iron pot and duck food.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma is 45 years old. She tills a two-hectare rice field in South Cotabato. She prepares the land for cultivation well in order to have a good harvest. However, she lacks the capital to purchase other necessary farm supplies. This is why she has joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. and is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP. The loan will enable her to purchase the farm supplies that she needs.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn L. is from the "barangay" (village) of Tuyabang, part of Oroquieta city. She is 43 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Merlyn owns and operates a food stall selling fish and seafood products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2004, Merlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.
