texts.en:
The members of the Kuña aty kyre community bank are currently in their eighth loan cycle with the program. The bank members are women who work as a team doing business in the community of San Ignacio in the Santo Angel neighborhood where they live. They are very united and constantly say how they learn daily how to get along together, and that by organizing themselves they can get ahead each day and achieve many benefits for themselves and their community.

They have become known in their community and all their neighbors help them with their activities, be they raffles, games, or activities for the children of the community. They hope to continue working together to continue growing as a group and thus strengthen the bank.

No., Name, Last Name, Activity 1) Corinda Luz A. de Paniagua, fabric and notions sales 2) Francisca Ramona A., fruit and clothing sales 3) Maria Roman S. Leguizamon Tambo, milk sales 4) Rossana Andrea C. Niñera, jewelry sales 5) Maria Cristina B. L., fruit and clothing sales 6) Juana Erenia M. de R., grocery 7) Claudia Carolina R. M., cakes and sweets sales 8) Agustina D. de Martinez, fruit and clothing sales 9) Andresa Teodora C. Nuñez, kiosk 10) Isabel C. L., vegetable sales 11) Fabiola Beatriz R. M., food sales 12) Matilde J. Olmedo, grocery 13) Maria del Carmen M., fruit and clothing sales 14) Maria Luisa L. de C., domestic employee 15) Rita C. A., fruit and clothing sales 16) Juana I. C., ticket sales  

Translated from Spanish by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The loans will be used for improving the businesses done by each woman such as enlarging shops, purchasing clothes, drugs, lingerie, personal articles, etc.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita, 27, is married and has two children.  Both are in school.  She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a tourist attraction community in the central region of Ghana.  Rita is a trader. She runs a provision store by the road side in the community.  Rita procures her goods from Accra.  Rita has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to increase her stock.

loans.use: Buy provisions.

loans.name: Edelvina

texts.es: Edelvina de  35 años, vive con su  esposo y sus 4 hijos en la casa de su suegra.Desde hace 13 años se dedica a 2 actividades que son esenciales para el sustento de su hogar;primero empezó con la fabricación de guitarras artesanales, también ofrece el servicio de espectáculos durante los fines de semana ,donde ella es la vocalista principal ,deleita a su público con su melodiosa voz entonando diversas canciones ; debe trabajar durante toda la semana  ya que con su esposo fabrica las  guitarras , y los fines de semana sale a cantar con su equipo de sonido ,además la acompaña una banda musical cuyos integrantes  son sus socios y se reparten las ganancias al finalizar los espectáculos . El sueño de Edelvina es tener una  fábrica con modernas herramientas para elaborar sus instrumentos musicales en menor tiempo y con mayor calidad, además de  tener un grupo musical consolidado.Es la sexta oportunidad que tiene un crédito con MFP, y durante todo el  tiempo de permanencia en su banco comunal ha sido muy puntual en los  pagos de sus cuotas.El dinero lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para fabricar sus guitarras, tales como barniz, madera, cuerdas, entre otros y también quiere adquirir un amplificador de sonido para sus espectáculos musicales.
texts.en:
Edelvina is 35 years old. She lives with her husband and four children in her mother-in-law's house. For 13 years she has been doing two activities that are essential for the livelihood of her home. First she began to manufacture artisinal guitars. She also offers the service of shows on the weekend in which she is the lead singer. She delights her audience with her melodious voice singing various songs. She has to work all week since she builds guitars with her husband, and weekends she sings with her musical equipment. She is also accompanied by a musical group whose members are her partners and they share the earnings after finishing the shows. Edelvina's dream is to have a factory with modern tools to produce her musical instruments in less time and more quality, in addition to having a consoldidated musical group. This is the sixth loan opportunity she has had with MFP. For the entire time she has been with the communal bank she has been very punctual with her payments. She will invest the money in the purchase of materials to build her guitars, such as varnish, wood, strings, among others. She also wants to acquire an amplifier for her musical shows.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve and outfit her business

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is 65 years old. She is widowed and has eight children, some are in school.  Aba lives with her children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana.  She works hard to provide for the family and is a trader of game meat.  Aba buys freshly hunted game from local hunters, smokes the meat and supplies food vendors in her community. Aba has been in business for over twenty years and wants to increase her stock and profits.  She wants to give her children a good education.

loans.use: Buy game meat.

loans.name: La Venta Group

texts.es:
El grupo la venta está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras muy capaces quienes aprovecharan estas fechas para seguir trabajando con la esperanza que el nuevo año sea mejor. 

Una de ellas es Juliana Canda H. quien comenzó con una pequeña venta ubicada en el kilómetro 17 carretera Masaya; pero por los altos costos que implicaba el alquiler la traslado a su domicilio. Aun con el traslado según Canda este año ha sido uno de los mejores de la venta. 

Aura Lila L. desde hace cuatro años vende ropa usada y con los créditos desde hace un año comercializa cosméticos de la marca Avon. Mientras María Magdalena R. en 2002 instalo una cerrajería en la cual trabaja junto con su esposo y este año nuevo si lo permite Dios desea remodelar su hogar.
texts.en:
The "La venta" group is made up of three hard-working and very capable women who take advantage of these dates to continue working with the hope that the new year will be better. One of them is Juliana Canda H. who began with a small shop located at kilometer 17 on the Masaya highway. Nevertheless, due to the high costs required with renting she moved to her home. Even with the move, according to Canda, this year has been one of the best for sales. For four years, Aura Lila Landex has sold used clothing and with the loans, she has sold Avon branded cosmetics for one year. Meanwhile, María Magdalena R. started a locksmiths business in 2002 where she works alongside her husband and, in this new year, as long as God permits it, she wishes to remodel her home.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic grains and other products.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence N. makes a living selling bags of water at Chapel Square near Elmina.  She has received a high-school education, is married and has three children. Her husband makes a living as a trader. Florence has been selling bags of water since 2000, and works hard to help her husband support their children and pay school fees and utility bills. She will use this loan to buy more bags of water to sell. Florence hopes to use additional income she earns to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of water to sell.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
El señor Victor Román tiene 48 años de edad vive con su esposa la señora Olga Luisa Jordán que tiene 40 años, tienen tres hijos, uno en edad escolar y otro cursando la secundaria, el señor Victor es propietario de la casa donde viven, donde tiene una despensa, la que pudo montar gracias a la ayuda de su señora quien es de profesión docente.
Se inicio como comerciante en el año 1990, y eligió este rubro ya que entonces no había mucho negocio y no iba a tener mucha competencia en la zona donde está ubicada desde entonces ha podido llevar adelante su negocio.
Desde el año 2002 empezó a trabajar con la  Fundación Paraguaya y con los préstamos recibidos  va creciendo su negocio 
El préstamo que solicita es para la compra de más mercaderías ya que se están aproximando las fiestas de fin de año.
texts.en:
Victor Román is 48 years of age and lives with his wife, Olga Luisa Jordán, who is 40 years old. They have three children, one who is school age and another who is in high school. Victor is the owner of the house where they live and where they have a grocery store, which they were able to start thanks to the help of his wife who is a teacher. He started as a trader in 1990 and he elected this career since at that time there were not a lot of businesses and he wouldn't have a lot of competition in the area where he's located. Since then, he has been able to get ahead with his business. Since the year 2002, he began to work with Fundación Paraguaya and with the loans received his business has been growing. The loan that he is requesting is to purchase more merchandise since the end of the year festivities are approaching.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise: Sugar, rice, noodles, oil, milk and other items.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 34 years old, married and the mother of six school aged children.  She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana.  Mary works hard to provide for her family. She is a trader of game meat, buying freshly hunted game from local hunters.  Mary smokes and supplies the meat to vendors in her community. Mary has been in business for fifteen years and wants a loan to procure meat in bulk. It is her desire to give all of her children a good education.

loans.use: Buy game meat.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is 39 years old, married and the mother of six children who are school age.  She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana.  Lydia works hard to support her family.  She prepares and sells food on a table by the road side.  Lydia has been in business for seventeen years and wants a loan to buy more bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: Buy bags of maize.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 33 years old, married and mother of three children who are in school.  She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana.  Grace is a rice trader. She supplies rice to food vendors in her community.  Grace also treks to nearby towns to supply rice.  She buys bags of rice from nearby towns and has been in business for six years.  Grace wants a loan to buy bags of rice in bulk so she can supply more customers.

loans.use: Buy bags of rice.

loans.name: Florencia Sonia

texts.es: LA Sra. Sonia, es cliente de Emprender desde el año 2004, ella trabajo en grupo solidario "CLAVELITOS"diez secuencias, luego solicito crédito individual con cinco secuencias, la Sra. Sonia trabaja acomodando sombreros y joyas  por la zona de Los Pinos y por Ovejuyo principalmente, ella trabaja como empleada del hogar en la zona Los Pinos, donde tiene su mercado, y donde ella vive, tiene su esposo quien trabaja como chofer asalariado y tambien se dedica a la venta de llantas que trae de Iquique, tienen cuatro hijos en edad escolar, pero dos de ellos trabajan en sus horas libres, la mayor como empleada de limpieza y el otro hijo como voceador, pese a algunos problemas familiares, ella pagó sus cuotas de manera puntual, ambos esposos se colaboran y cumplen con sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Sonia has been a client of Emprender since 2004. She worked with the solidarity group “Clavelitos” for ten loan cycles. She later received five individual loans.

Sra. Sonia sells hats and jewelry primarily in the districts of Los Pinos and Ovejuyo. In addition, she works as a housekeeper in the Los Pinos district, which is also where she lives and where the market she sells is located. Her husband works as a salaried driver and also sells tires that are shipped in from Iquique. They have four school-age children, but two of them also work during their free time. The oldest child cleans houses, while the other child sells newspapers. Despite some family problems, she has been able to pay her loans in a timely manner. She and husband work together so that she is able to make her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther A. is single and has one child. She has received no formal education, and makes a living selling cooked yam, rice and plantain on the seashore near Elmina on the Cape Coast. She has been in this line of work since 2004, and uses her income to help pay school fees and utility bills.  Esther will use this loan to buy more yams, rice, and fish to sell. With the new income made possible by this loan, she will continue to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more yams, rice, and fish to sell.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is 42 years old, married and mother to seven children who are in school.  She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana.  Ama trades maize and supplies vendors in her community.  Ama also treks to nearby towns to supply customers.  Ama buys maize from nearby farmers. She has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to buy more bags of maize in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: Buy bags of maize.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is 35 years old, married and mother to seven school age children.  She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Margaret works hard and is a trader of maize. She supplies maize to food vendors in her community and treks to nearby towns as well.  She buys bags of maize from nearby farming communities.  Margaret has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: Buy bags of maize

loans.name: Las Hijas Del Rey Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las Hijas del Rey está integrado por Karla M., Zeneida O. y Elizabeth del Socorro P. tres féminas trabajadoras, quienes desean que este próximo año sus negocios progresen y tener salud para continuar trabajando.  

Karla M. para ganarse el pan de cada día ha incursionado en varios negocios desde la venta de gaseosa, refrescos, comida, hasta el comercio de ropa y cosméticos de la marca Zermat. Este año según M. aun con sus altibajos le atraído bastantes alegrías en su negocio por su crecimiento y en lo familiar por que sus hijos están estudiando y salieron bien en clases. 

Este préstamo lo invertirá en compra de ropa y cosméticos ya que en está es lo de mayor demanda en este tiempo. Mientras Zeneida  O. utilizará el préstamo para comprar carne, leña y maíz para vender y hacer tortillas.
 
Este negocio lo desempeña desde 10 años con el cual le ha proporcionado los estudios universitarios a su hijo de 23 años y su hija de 9 años. Su compañera Elizabeth P. que también con su comercio de bisutería y productos lácteos les provee de todo a sus dos pequeños.
texts.en:
The group Las Hijas del Rey [Daughters of the King] is made up of Karla M., Zeneida O., and Elizabeth del Socorro P.. They are three hardworking women who want this New Year to bring them progress in their businesses and health to continue working.

To earn her daily bread, Karla M. has ventured into several businesses, from the sale of soft drinks and food to sales of clothing and Zermat cosmetics. She says that this year, though it had ups and downs, brought happiness; her business has grown and her children are studying and earned good marks in their classes. Karla will use this loan to purchase clothing and cosmetics, as there is increased demand in this season.

Meanwhile, Zeneida O. will use the loan to buy meat, firewood, and corn to make and sell tortillas. This business has supported her for ten years and has paid for university for her son, 23, and school for her daughter, 9.

Elizabeth P., with her business of miscellaneous goods and dairy products, also provides everything for her two young children.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing, cosmetics, and other merchandise and supplies

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en: Ernestina N. is married and has one child. She received a high-school education and makes a living selling stationary in a new market near Elmina on the Cape Coast. She has been working in this field since 1997, and her husband is a trader. They use their income to pay for many things, including school fees and utility bills. Ernestina has applied for a loan to buy more stationary to sell. She plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stationary to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 44 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en la casa heredada de sus padres.Desde hace 4 años decidió emprender su propio negocio, empezó  con la venta de  productos comestibles  en un pequeño  espacio que disponía en su casa, desde entonces, brinda una cálida y amable atención a sus clientes que consumen los productos frescos y de buena calidad que ofrece, atiende todos los días, incluso los fines de semana, sus hijos  la apoyan en estas labores cuando tienen un tiempo libre porque estudian. Elizabeth quiere  mejorar su tienda y surtirla con mayor cantidad de mercadería.Es la sexta oportunidad que tiene un crédito con  MFP, y  es una de las socias que  promueve la puntualidad de los pagos con su ejemplo en su banco comunal.El dinero solicitado será invertido en la compra de  abarrotes para ofrecer mayor variedad de productos en su tienda, para seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 44 years old. She lives with her two children in a house she inherited from her parents. Four years ago, she decided to start her own business. She began selling food products in a small space inside her house. Since then, she has provided warm and friendly service to her customers who use the fresh, high quality products that she provides. She serves her customers every day including weekends. Her children help her work when they have free time from studying. Elizabeth wants to improve her store and supply it with a larger quantity of merchandise. This is the sixth loan opportunity she has had with MFP and is one of the community bank members who promotes the punctuality of payments by example. The requested money will be invested in the purchase of groceries so she can offer a greater variety of products at her store and help her business continue to progress.

Translated from Spanish by Colleen Godfrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of merchandise to expand the variety of her store

loans.name: Leslie Patricia

texts.es:
Doña Leslie es cliente antigua anteriomente ya trabajo dentro de uno de los Bancos de Emprendimiento llamado Pagando en Fe y Amor luego por razones de tiempo dejo el grupo, pasado a ser parte de uno de nuestros clientes individuales, durante todo este tiempo se ha podido evidenciar no solo el crecimiento de la cliente a nivel personal, sino tambien el del mismo negocio.  
La señora se dedica a repartir prendas de vestir tales como pantalones, blusas, chompas, carteras,etc. en oficinas del centro de la ciudad donde ella ya cuenta con un numero determinado de clientes.   
La cliente vive en casa familiar en el que ocupa un departamento de manera conjunta con su mama y su pequeño hijo; entre ambas se encargan de la manutencion del hogar.  El Proposito del credito es el de comprar una cantidad mayor de prendas de vestir para poderlas comercializar en estas fiestas de Navidad y fin de año.
texts.en:
Doña Leslie is a long-time client who previously worked with one of the Communal Banks called “Pagando en Fe y Amor” (Paying in Faith and Love). She later left the group and became of our individual loan clients. Not only has she grown on a personal level, Leslie has also developed in her business during this time.

She is a clothing distributor, selling items such as pants, blouses, sweaters, handbags, and other items. Leslie visits several offices downtown where she already has several established customers. She lives in an apartment with her mother and her young son. Both she and her mother are responsible for maintaining the household. Her loan will be used to buy a large quantity of clothing to sell during the Christmas and New Year’s holidays.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Guillermina's Group

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic necessity merchandise: clothing, beverages, fruit, vegetables, cassava; as well as other products: jewelry, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita Y. is single and has two children. She graduated from the local junior high school, and makes a living selling fresh and canned tomatoes, ground pepper, palm and cooking oil and other items at Chapel Square near Elmina. She has been doing this since 2005, and uses her income to help pay school fees and utility bills. Rita has applied for a loan to buy more items to sell, and will use the additional income she earns to pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to sell.

loans.name: Casilda

texts.es:
La señora Casilda es casada, tiene dos hijos varones, estudiantes y comerciantes a la vez. Toda la familia se dedica en macate; es decir venta ambulante de mercaderías a crédito. 
El crédito solicitado es para aumentar un stock de mercaderías, en esta temporada ellos entregan en forma masiva los productos y después va cobrando a sus clientelas en forma semanal, quincenal y o mensual dependiendo de los ingresos de los mismos.
La señora Casilda tiene agradece con el apoyo de toda la familia y gracias a esos tiene casa propia y va incrementando sus ingresos que en el futuro le va a servir para tener una vida más digna.
texts.en:
Casilda is married. She has two adult sons who are students and businessmen at the same time. The whole family is dedicated in Macate. That is, they sell merchandise for credit on foot. The loan requested is to increase their stock of merchandise. In this season, they deliver their goods in bulk and later charge their customers on a weekly, biweekly, or monthly basis depending in their income. Casilda is thankful for the support of her family and thanks to them she has her own home and is increasing her income which, in the future, will allow her to have a more dignified life.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pans, coffee pots, baking sheets, and other items.

loans.name: Estrellita Group

texts.es:
Lorena G., Sobeyda H., Ruth C. y Geraldine C. integran al grupo Estrellitas. Estas cuatro féminas del  barrio Memorial Sandino han trabajado arduamente durante este año para aumentar sus negocios y en estas fechas esperan seguir así.

 Lorena G. de 32 años inicio vendiendo frijoles cocidos empezó ahorrar parte de las ganancias y con los prestamos que obtuvo en adim pudo empezar a vender ropa y cosméticos lo cual le ayudado a mejorar su situación económica que era tan precaria.

Sobeyda H. de 28 años comercializa CD, frutas y verduras, Ruth C. vende zapatos y tiene una pequeña pulpería   y Geraldine C. empezó vendiendo hielo y helados después empezó a realizar frescos naturales y a ofrecer gaseosa.
texts.en:
Lorena G., Sobeyda H., Ruth C., and Geraldine C. comprise the Estrellitas group. These four women are from the Memorial Sandino neighborhood. They have worked arduously during this year to expand their businesses. These days they hope to continue in the same manner. Lorena G., 32, sells cooked beans. She started saving part of her earnings, and with the loans she got from ADIM, she was able to start selling clothing and cosmetics. This helped improve her precarious economic situation. Sobeyda H., 28, sells CDs, fruit, and vegetables. Ruth C. sells shoes, and she has a small mini market. Geraldine C. started selling ice and ice cream after she starting selling natural drinks and soft drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes

loans.name: Faustian

texts.en:
Faustian A. is a single woman with two children. She notes that she received a junior high school education.

To earn a living, Faustian sells soft drinks at a fish port near Elmina. In fact, she has been in this line of business since 2007. By doing so, she is able to pay for her children's school fees and her utility bills. She is now seeking a loan in the amount of $500, which would be used to buy more soft drinks and bags of water for sale. She hopes to use any additional profits from her business as a result of this loan to further her children’s education.

loans.use: To improve and expand her business by purchasing additional soft drinks and water

loans.name: Jaquelinne

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Jaquelinne tiene 26 años y tiene siete meses de embarazo. La socia tiene dos hijos, Sandro tiene siete años y Anne tiene cuatro años de edad. La socia Jaquelinne es natural de la ciudad de Urcos de la provincia de Quispicanchis del departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “Qori Orcco” de la Asociación Arariwa. La ciudad de Urcos se encuentra a 45 Km. de la Ciudad del Cusco aproximadamente a 45 minutos de viaje. 

La socia se levanta muy temprano para hacer sus actividades del hogar como por ejemplo hacer desayunar a sus hijos y después enviarlos al colegio. La socia después de hacer sus actividades del hogar tiene que ir a vender pan a la Plaza de Armas de la ciudad de Urcos. Ella nos cuenta que desde muy niña ayudaba a su mamá a elaborar el pan y a vender. Ella aprendió de las enseñazas de su mamá y ahora la socia Jaquelinne tiene su propio negocio.  Ella y sus compañeras de negocio desde hace 2 años atrás se les ocurrió crear un pan especial que lo llamaron “chuta navideña” que tiene las mismas características del pan chuta (Pan redondo blando con un olor peculiar y es un pan gigante, pan típico de la ciudad de Urcos) pero le agregaron pasas y frutas. La socia y sus compañeras de negocio solo preparan este pan “Chuta navideña” para las fiestas de navidad. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar mas insumos como harina, azúcar, manteca, frutas y pasas para preparar las “chutas navideñas” para esta navidad ya que por estas épocas es donde se vende más. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Jaquelinne is 26 years old and is seven months pregnant. She has two children, Sandro, 7, and Anne, 4. Jaquelinne is a native of the city of Urcos, province of Quispicanchis, and department of Cusco. She belongs to the “Qori Orcco” communal bank of the Asociación Arariwa. Urcos is 45 km. from the city of Cusco, about a 45-minute journey.

Jaquelinne gets up very early to do her housework, such as making breakfast for her children and sending them off to school. After doing her household chores, she goes to sell bread in the Plaza de Armas of the city of Urcos. She says that from a young age, she helped her mother make and sell bread. She learned the lessons of her mother and now has her own business.

Two years ago, Jaquelinne and her work partners had the idea to create a special bread that they called “Chuta Navideña” [Christmas Chuta]. It has the same characteristics as normal chuta bread (a large, soft, round bread with particular smell that is traditional in Urcos) with the addition of raisins and fruit. They only prepare this bread for the Christmas holidays.

This loan is needed to purchase the ingredients for this season’s “Chutas Navideñas,” such as flour, sugar, butter, fruits, and raisins. Jaquelinne is grateful for this opportunity, and commits to making her payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy flour, sugar, butter fruit, and raisins for “chutas navideñas”.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth D., 34 years old, is a mother of two children. Her eldest child is 9 years old. Her livelihood is rice farming. She has a 1-hectare farm that she  hopes could provide her with enough income to buy an adequate supply of food, clothes and other basic needs. She started her business in 2000 and joined the CEVI credit program last year in 2008.

She would like to request for a loan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to augment her harvest and income.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa C., 44  years old, is a CEVI client and farmer from Norala, South Cotabato in Mindanao. She manages a small parcel of rice fields, which she hopes could provide her family with adequate supplies of food, clothing and other basic needs. 

She is hoping to receive a loan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy needed farm supplies in order to increase the size of her harvest and income.

loans.use: farm supplies

loans.name: Jesús Teresa

texts.es: Teresa tiene 52 años, vive con sus hijas en su casa que es propia. Desde hace 11 años se dedica a la atención en su tienda y se encarga del abastecimiento de la mercadería, no le gusta que falte nada, de esta manera trabaja todos los días sin descanso con el  fin de seguir adelante y progresar, recibe en ocasiones la ayuda de una de sus hijas y disfruta de lo que hace porque  es un espacio donde puede socializar con sus clientes, y esa es  su gran satisfacción, para el futuro  desea tener una  gran tienda con mas cantidad y calidad de mercadería.Es la  sexta oportunidad que tiene un crédito con  MFP, y es una de las socias  que siempre cumple responsablemente con cada una de sus cuotas. El dinero  solicitado lo utilizará en la compra de mayor cantidad de  mercadería para su tienda.
texts.en:
Teresa is 52 years old. She lives with her daughters in a house that is her own. For 11 years, she has dedicated her attention to her shop and she is in charge of the supply of merchandise. She does not like to lack anything. In this manner, she works everyday without rest with a goal to get ahead and progress. On occasion, she receives the help of one of her daughters and she enjoys what she does because it is a space where she can socialize with her customers and that brings her great satisfaction. In the future, she wishes to have a big store with greater quantity and quality of merchandise. This is the sixth opportunity for her to have a loan with MFP and she is one of the members who always meets every one of her payments responsibly. The money requested will be used for the purchase of a great quantity of merchandise for her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a greater quantity of merchandise.

loans.name: Ilyn

texts.en:
Ilyn M. is a 46-year-old married woman with two children. Her oldest child is 20 years old, and she and her husband have been married for almost 20 years now.

To earn a living, she works on her farm. However, she needs additional capital for her business. As such, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP ($325) through Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI). She would like to use the loan proceeds to buy farm supplies. She explains that she liked CEVI's program because, aside from the low (2%) interest rate charged by CEVI, she was able to secure insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional farm supplies

loans.name: Jill

texts.en:
Jill C., 57 years old, is a mother of five adult children. She is also a farmer, and she grows corn and rice in Banga, South Cotabato in Mindanao. Currently, she tills a 1-hectare corn and rice field. Her farm is doing well and she wishes to make it more productive to augment her income.

She needs additional capitalization in her business. She wants to avail a loan of Php 12, 000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies. She will also pay the laborers, who helped her prepare the soil for planting.

loans.use: Farm supplies and payment to laborers

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
El señor Gerardo V. está muy agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual pudo pagar los gastos escolares de sus hijos. 
Esta nuevamente solicitando un préstamo para reparar la barda trasera de su casa, ya que le preocupa la seguridad de su familia. 
El planea pagar el crédito con sus ingresos que obtiene de su empleo en una compañía de trasportes. 
Desea que su familia tenga seguridad, ya que tiene cuatro hijos y le preocupa que le pueda pasar algo.
texts.en:
Gerardo V. is very thankful for your cooperation with the last loan, which enabled him to pay his children's school bills. He is requesting a new loan to repair the fence behind his house since he is worried about the safety of his family. He plans to pay the loan with the income that he obtains from his job at a transportation company. He wishes that his family has security since he has four children and he worries that something may happen to them.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair the fence behind his house.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza L., 41 years old, is a rice farmer from Norala in South Cotabato. Her family relies very much on her farm. Whatever income she makes from growing rice, it is a big help for her family to be able to buy food, clothing and other basic needs. She started tilling the farm in 1987. She will not stop until she is able to make all her children graduate from school.

She would like to request for a loan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies. In that way, she will be able to increase her harvest and income.

loans.use: farm supplies

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Descripción: El señor Santiago tiene una despensa en su casa y una librería en el mercado de abasto, trabaja conjuntamente con su esposa, ambos se ayudan en las dos actividades, ellos quieren el crédito para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, el cual necesita de una inyección constante de capital para seguir creciendo y así satisfacer las demandas de sus clientes. 
Don Santiago tiene casa propia y quiere mejorarlas por lo que siempre hace un esfuerzo por mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Santiago runs a convenience store from his house and he has a supply stand in the large market. He works together with his wife and they both contribute to each business. They request a loan to keep investing in their business, which is constant need of capital funds to maintain its growth and to meet the clients' demands.

Santiago has his own home and he would like to improve his business, so that his revenues will increase.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase paper, pens and other items.

loans.name: Margelyn

texts.en:
Margelyn A. is 40 years old and has a farm. She manages to grow rice so that she will be able to help her family buy food, clothing and other basic needs. She has been a farmer since she was born. Her parents are farmers and all her life was spent on the farm. 

She would like to grow her business. She needs additional capitalization and requests for a loan of Php 15, 000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She plans to buy farm supplies so that she will be assured of a quality harvest and income. The loan will truly help her expand her business as well.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Esther Group

texts.es:
El grupo Esther está integrado por Damarys de los Ángeles H. quien comenzó hace dos años vender zapatos y ropa en pequeñas cantidades actualmente comercializa mayor cantidad de productos. 

Las otras integrantes son Alma Nidia C. M. vende perfumes y Carmen Isabel Gonzáles distribuye bisutería.
texts.en:
The Esther group was formed by Damarys de los Ángeles H., who started out two years ago selling shoes and clothing in small quantities. Now she sells larger quantities of products. The other members are Alma Nidia C. M., who sells perfumes, and Carmen Isabel Gonzáles, who distributes costume jewelry.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing and shoes

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou F., 44 years old , is a mother and a farmer in Norala, South Cotabato in Mindanao. She has three children, who also help her on the farm, tilling the soil. They work as a team from morning until sunset, so that they will be able to ensure that they will have an abundant harvest. This is because they take seriously the growing of their rice crop. 

She hopes to receive a loan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies. In that way she will be able to improve the size of her harvest and income as well.

loans.use: farm supplies

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca C. is 40  years old. She has a farm. Her main crop is rice, because people in her village are constantly buying it as food for their respective families. She has three adult children, who also help her grow rice. She dreams to improve her livelihood and tries to venture into other income opportunities when she has capital. 

She is asking for a loan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. The loan will go far in buying farm supplies to grow her harvest and income. She will also use some of the loan to start a new business.

loans.use: Farm Supplies & Start New Business

loans.name: Maria Valeria

texts.es:
La señora Maria Valeria C. M. tiene 54 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 9 hijos.  
Posee una venta cerca del mercado municipal de granos básicos,  entre ellos esta el frijol (producto que más vende), pepita, maicillo y maíz.
Ella se encuentra feliz con la ayuda que FAPE le ha dado,  su negocio ha crecido y con el mantiene a sus 5 hijos menores de edad,  los otros 4 hijos ya estan casados y no le pueden ayudar a ella.  También tiene crianza de pollos y marranos en su casa.   Vende en el mercado municipal los días jueves y domingos, en las fiestas pratronales y no depende de otros ingresos para vivir.
Su sueño es tener un local en el mercado municipal de San M.,  ya que ella vende en la calle de San Martín (cerca del mercado municipal).
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Valeria C. M. is 54 years old. She is married with nine children. She has a stall near the municipal market with basic grains, among them beans (the product she sells most), pumpkin seeds, millet and corn. She is very happy with the help FAPE has given her. Her business has grown, and with it she supports her five youngest children. The other four children are married, and they are unable to help her. She also raises chickens and pigs at home. She sells them at the municipal market Thursdays, Sundays and festival days for patron saints. She does not rely on other revenue to make her living. Her dream is to have a premises in the San M. municipal market, as she now sells in San M. Street (near the municipal market).

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of beans and sale of corn

loans.name: Sanita

texts.en:
Sanita S., 52 years old, is a farmer. She is helping her husband till a 1-hectare farm to produce quality corn Sanita has been a farmer since 1982. The income she receives from the farm has benefited her family especially since it helps them pay their daily expenses and for things like food and clothing.  When she started to farm, Sanita joined also in the CEVI credit program. 

She would like to request another loan of Php 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies. In that way, she will be able to have an abundant harvest.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Gladis Del Rosario

texts.es: Gladis del Rosario C. D. A. D. 41 años D. edad, resiD. en Colón en el departamento D. La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos D. 17 y 14 años D. edad. Ella posee una venta D. comida típica, tiene una tienda D. productos perecederos y también cría y venD. pollos. Gladis es una persona muy admirada y querida en su colonia ya que es alguien que trabaja mucho por sacar adelante a su familia, y para poder brindarle la ayuda necesaria a su esposo con los del hogar. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más productos perecederos, así mismo desea poder comprar mayor cantidad D. comida para aves.
texts.en:
Gladis del Rosario C. D. A. is 41 years old. She lives in Colón in the region of La Libertad. She lives with her husband and her two children, 17 and 14 years old. She has a stall where she sells typical local foods, a shop of perishable goods, and she also raises and sells chickens. Gladis is a person who is much admired and loved by her neighbours, as she is someone who works hard to raise her family and to be able to offer her husband the help he needs with the household. She is requesting a loan with which she would be able to purchase more perishable goods; she would also like to be able to purchase a larger quantity of bird food.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bird food and perishable goods.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina C. L., de 45 años de edad es casada, con dos hijos.  Ella tiene un venta de consumo diario dentro del mercado municipal.  Ella vende golosina, papel higiénico, gaseosas, chicles, cereales, etc.  Ella vende  los días, domingos, martes, y jueves. 
 
Ya está contenta ya que antes, tenía cosas, pero pocas.  Con la ayuda de FAPE, ella surtió su tienda y colocó cosas o cereales que la gente le pedía.  Hoy en día, las puede comprar y vender.  Antes, no lo podía porque le faltaba dinero.  Ella solicita este préstamo par utilizar para comprar más consumos diarios, también ropa típica para vender.  

Mantiene a sus hijos ya que están en la edad escolar.  Su esposo es barbero, y ella les ayuda también.  Su sueño es tener un deposito para poder vender a lo grande.
texts.en:
Paulina C. L., 45 years old, is married with two children. She has a stall selling goods for daily consumption in the municipal market. She sells candy, toilet paper, carbonated drinks, chewing gum, grains, etc. Her stall is open on Sundays, Tuesdays and Thursdays. She is happy because before, she had things, but very little. With the help of FAPE, she supplied her shop and invested in items or grains that people had requested. Today, she is able to buy and sell them. Before, she couldn't because she didn't have enough money. She is requesting this loan so she can use it to purchase more basic consumables as well as traditional clothing to sell. She supports her children, who are still schoolaged. Her husband is a barber, and she helps him too. Her dream is to have a store to be able to sell on a large scale.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase traditional clothes and basic consumables for a shop.

loans.name: Yana Yolanda

texts.es:
Yana T. de 44 años de edad, tiene una casa de cemento ubicada en el Fortín de Guayaquil, esta en unión libre con su pareja el le ayuda con los gastos de la familia siendo albañil en urbanizaciones de Guayaquil, tiene 2 hijos uno estudia en una escuela Particular y su otro hijo trabaja. 

Yana comenzó su negocio hace 2 años atrás, con sus ahorros compro pollos para criadero y así ella mismo los mataba y los entregaba a sus clientes. Ahora ella vende pollos listos para cocinar a $ 5.60 según lo que pesen. Trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 12h00, una de las mayores complicaciones que ella tiene es la competencia de las tiendas, y la delincuencia.

Con el préstamo Yana quiere comprar más pollos y arreglar el criadero para agrandar el negocio. En el futuro quiere comprar un solar por su sector para tener otro criadero de pollos, y con esto que le ayude a poner un bazar para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Yana T. is 44 years old and has a cement house situated in Fortín de Guayaquil. She is in a common law relationship with her partner who helps her with family expenses, being a mason in residential developments of Guayaquil. She has two children: one studies in a private school, and her other child works. Yana began her business two years ago. With her savings, she bought chickens to raise, and she herself slaughtered them and delivered them to her customers. Now she sells chickens ready to cook for $5.60, according to their weight. She works from 7:00 a.m. until 12 noon. One of her biggest problems is competition from other shops and petty crime. With the loan, Yana wants to buy more chickens and fix up the coop in order to expand her business. In the future, she would like to buy some land in her area in order to have another chicken coop, which would help her to set up a shop for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase chickens and fix up chicken coop.

loans.name: Calero Group

texts.es:
El grupo C. esta conformado por tres compañeros uno de ellos es Doris Isabel C. de 28 años que comercializa frutas y verduras. Ella desde hace seis años empezó a comprar cosechas de la fruta o verduras que está en flota y luego las revende. 

Mientras Pedro Ofilio N. de 52 años vende leña, frutas y atiende un pequeño bar junto con sus cuatro hijos quienes trabajan con el. Marvin L. compra árboles para picar leña para luego  revenderla.
texts.en:
The C. group is comprised of 3 members. One of these is Doris Isabel C., 28 years old, who sells fruits and vegetables. She started this business 6 years ago when she began to buy harvested fruits and vegetables that were in season and later resold them. Pedro Ofilio Narvaez, 52, sells firewood and fruit and tends a small bar along with his four sons who work with him. Marvin L. buys trees to chop firewood and later sell it.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables
